loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo José Cuaresma , tiene la edad de 32 años , habita en el barrio Pablo C. , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como operaria en pollos Tip-Top , para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene dos hijos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , ya que quiere agrandar un poco mas la casa y hacer cuartos para cada uno de sus hijos , desde hace once años don Reynaldo se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es el humo del volcán , agradece a Afodenic por la buena aprobación de su noveno préstamo , el cual lo va a invertir en insumos para la producción de piña lo cual espera venderlo a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Reynaldo José Cuaresma is 32 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Pablo C., located in the municipio of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife who works as an operator at Tip-Top chickens to help him with the household expenses. They have two children and the plans for their family are to improve living conditions since they want to partially extend their house to make rooms for each one of their children. For 11 years Reynaldo has worked in agriculture, with the biggest affectation that he is confronted with being volcanic smoke. He is grateful to Afodenic for providing him with his ninth loan which he is going to invest in consumables for the production of pineapple which he hopes to sell at a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of consumables and fertilizers for farming use

loans.name: John A.

texts.en: John A. B. is thirty-eight. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children who are attending schools.Three are in secondary schools and one is in primary school. John is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his childen.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
This is James K.. James is seeking his very first loan from Kiva lenders through SMT. He wants a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to buy house building materials.

James is age thirty, married and with two children. James' children are attending schools – one is in class II and the other is in nursery school.

loans.use: To buy house building materials.

loans.name: Samuel B.

texts.en:
Here is Samuel B. C.. Samuel is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 from Kiva lenders through SMT for the first time to invest in his business and pay school fees for two of his children.

Samuel sells rice and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). He has been in business for many years now. He is thirty years old and is married with six children between the ages of one and 18.

loans.use: To invest in his rice and palm oil business.

loans.name: Juan Santiago

texts.es: Don Juan se dedica al lavado de arena y piedra para la construccion, en el río Jachaconi, ubicado en la comunidad de Chinchaya, a 35 Km. aproximadamente de la ciudad de La Paz, junto a la cordillera de Los Andes; lugar conocido porque en ese río se puede encontrar bastante arena y piedra, Don Juan extrae la arena y la  separa en arena fina y en arena corriente; piedras manzana y piedras semi bruta; material que se utiliza en la construcción. Vive junto a su esposa que se dedica a las labores de la casa, y a mediodía le lleva su merienda a su esposo, para ello realiza un recorrido de aproximadamente 10 Km. a pie. El crédito será invertido en la cancelación de un anticipo para la compra de un terreno, para la construccion de su casa; ya que en la actualidad su casa se vió afectada por una mazamorra (riada) destruyendo una gran parte de ella.
texts.en:
Juan washes sand and rocks for construction. He washes them in the Jachaconi River, which is in the Chinchaya community approximately 35 kilometers from the city of La Paz near the Los Andes mountain range. This place is known because you can find plenty of rock and sand in this river. Juan extracts the sand and separates it into fine sand and common sand. He also separates the rocks into material that can be used in construction. He lives with his wife, who devotes herself to the work in the house. At midday she brings her husband his meal. To do so, she travels approximately ten kilometers on foot. The loan is to make an advance payment for a piece of land to build his house. Currently his house has been affected by floods, which destroyed a great part of it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make an advance payment for a piece of land to build his house

loans.name: Olga Melania

texts.en:
Olga runs a business selling tortillas from her home. She makes her tortillas on her kitchen table and stovetop. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her tortillas in bulk. If she can buy corn for her tortillas by the quintal (46kg or 101lbs), she will be able to sell her tortillas for less. This will make her more competitive.

Loans from CEPRODEL have helped Olga already. She said she likes that she can maintain herself and earn her own living. Olga is 41 years old. She is single with no children living at home. She has had a tortilla business for the last 4 years. Initially, she started her business with C$1,000 (US$ 50) that she received from her children.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making tortillas

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: La señora Natalia vive en la comunidad de Chicani, aproximadamente a 40 Km de la ciudad  de La Paz, se dedica a la venta de leche , tiene dos vacas lecheras cada una produce 12 litros al día los vende a la empresa  lechera PIL, lleva  20 años con esta actividad, tiene una hija pequeña, su esposo está en Argentina trabajando en costura, pero  volverá este mes y se quedará a trabajar aquí con su esposa. Sus suegros siempre la apoyan y velan por su bienestar y el de su nieta. El crédito será invertido en la compra de dos terneritos (dos toros pequeños), es una cliente muy responsable y puntual.
texts.en:
Natalia lives in the community of Chicani, approximately 40 kilometers from the city of La Paz. Her business is selling milk. She has two milk cows producing 12 liters per day, which she sells to the PIL dairy company. She has worked in this field for 20 years. She has a small daughter; her husband is currently in Argentina working as a tailor, but he will return this month and remain here to work with his wife. Her parents-in-law always support her and ensure that she and their grandchild are doing well. The loan will be invested in purchasing two bull calves. Natalia is a very responsible and punctual client.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing two calves

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel K. is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 from Kiva lenders. He wants this loan to pay school fees for his children.

Samuel is thirty-eight years old. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children who are attending school: three of his children are attending secondary schools and one is in primary school.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Carmen Alvarado

texts.en:
Carmen has a stall in the El Bisne Market in Chinandega. Since Carmen sells meat to her customers, her stall or “tramo” is located near all the other meat sellers. Carmen is requesting a loan to buy a cow that she will butcher. After she butchers the animals, she sells the meat by the pound. She has been working in her meat stall for the past 6 years.

Before she began selling meat, Carmen had many other jobs, but she was always working for someone else. Now with the loans she has her own business which allows her to support herself and offer quality services to her customers.

loans.use: To buy a cow to butcher

loans.name: Alie Osman

texts.en:
Alie Osman K. is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to help him invest in his market food business.

Alie is thirty-five years old, married to a businesswoman and they have five children. One of Alie’s children is in secondary school, three are in primary schools and the last is not of school-going age.

loans.use: To invest in his business.

loans.name: El Samaritario 3 And 6 Group

texts.en:
Julissa is the group coordinator for Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) El Samaritano (The Samaritan). Her story is representative of the others in her group and more generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients. Julissa lives in Hato Mayor, a rural province in the Dominican Republic. She has two children that live with her in a house that has unreliable access to electricity and has no running water. 

Julissa sells clothing to the people who live in her community. She plans to use this loan to buy underwear, socks and bras to sell. Julissa has successfully paid back one loan with Esperanza and wants to use this second loan to continue to grow her business. She dreams of being a professional businesswoman and would like to own her own store. Julissa wants to succeed in business so that she can educate her children and provide for their needs. She thanks you for helping her achieve her goals!

loans.use: Clothes to sell including: underwear, socks, bras.

loans.name: Maria Delma

texts.en:
Maria has been making and selling food in the El Bisne Market in Chinandega for the past 5 years. She has a stall in the prepared food section of the market. She has tables and chairs for her customers to use. She is requesting this loan to buy staple grains (such as corn) in bulk. If she buys in bulk, she can purchase her ingredients much cheaper.

Maria is 68 years old. She is single with adult children. Her children helped her start her food business. Initially, she sold food from her home. Now her business is large enough to have a stall at the market. Maria says loans from CEPRODEL have helped her considerably. They have especially helped buy ingredients for preparing food.

loans.use: To buy staple grains such as corn in bulk

loans.name: Almanso Group

texts.en:
This is Alimany D., Zainab K., Agnes L. and Marie L.. They named their group Almanso Group. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each for the first time from Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

Alimany D. (right) is the leader of this group. Alimany is age twenty-six and he was born in Freetown. He is married to a businesswoman and they have two children – one in class one and the other is not of school-going age. Alimany is a driver who plies between the Makeni and Magburaka highway, and also sells ground-nut/peanuts. He has been in this business for seven years now. Alimany will invest this loan in his ground-nut business.

loans.use: To invest in his ground-nut business.

loans.name: Adimdin Group

texts.en:
These people are Kadiatu S., Adama K., Fatu S., and Ramatu T.. They named their group 'Adimdin'. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each for the first time from Kiva Lenders through SMT. With the help of this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living.

Kadiatu S. is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is age forty-two; she was born in Matham village about seven miles from Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. Kadiatu is married with five children, all of whom are attending secondary schools. Kadiatu sells cigarettes, matches, mints, and biscuits at her home in Magburaka town. She has been in this business for seven year now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: No One Knows Tomorrow Group

texts.en:
Fatmata F., Isatu C., Zainab K. and Fatmata K. call their group No One Knows Tomorrow. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to help them develop their businesses. With the aid of this loan, their businesses will increase both in size and quality, attracting more customers so that sales. profits, and their standard of living will improve.

Fatmata F., a 40-year-old divorced mother of six, is the leader of this group. Four of Fatmata’s children are attending secondary schools, while two are not yet of school-going age. In business for more than ten years now, Fatmata sells flour, sugar, rice, cakes, bread and cigarettes.

loans.use: Invest in their  businesses

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is a member of a communal bank that consists 15 neighbors who live in Ccorao, a town that is 30 minutes from Cusco, Peru. The loan group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao and is named after a virgin of Peru. Victoria is from Ccorao. She is 40 years old and is single. She sells a Peruvian grain called "tarwi" (See a description of tarwi in Wikipedia) in a nearby market. She earns approximately 400 soles every week, which is equivalent to approximately $140 USD. She says that the money that Arariwa lends her helps her business to grow. With this loan, she will buy more tarwi to sell. Victoria appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more grains to sell

loans.name: Believe God Group

texts.en:
The members of the Believe God group are small-scale businesswomen in the town of Magburaka, located in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of Le 500,000 each for the very first time to enable them to improve their businesses. With such a loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. In this way, they can make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve – they will be able to better support their school-going children in terms of feeding, clothing and meeting school expenses.

Zainab F. (on the left in the photo), born in Matotoka village, is the leader of this group. Thirty-eight years old, she is married to a farmer, and they have five children, all attending either primary or secondary schools. Zainab sells market food – rice, pepper, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) etc.- in Masimgbin village, about 25 miles from Magburaka town. She has been doing business now for many years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Kamuyu United Group

texts.en:
Abubakarr K., Mabinty F. and Mariatu C. call their group Kamuyu United. They have already received and repaid several loans, each having had meaningful impacts on the business and personal lives of these entrepreneurs. Abubakar, for example, now has a car he is using in town and can still afford to sponsor his school-going children as a result of SMT/Kiva loans. Having fully repaid their last loan, they are now requesting a new one of SLL 800,000 each to further strengthen their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and improve their standard of living.

Abubakar K. (left) is the leader of this group. Born in Magburaka town, located in northern Sierra Leone, he is 45 years of age and married with four children, three in primary school and one in secondary school. Abubakar’s wife is also a businesswoman. Abubakar has been a welder for 25 years now and will use this loan to buy working materials including bottles of gas and a drum filled with carbide.

loans.use: Buy working tools

loans.name: Catholic United Group

texts.en:
Here are Patricia F. G., Cecilia F. K. and Nahomi K.. They are members of the Catholic United group. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. They have been in business for many years now but business has been developing at a very slow pace. They have thus come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leones each to help them improve their businesses. 

Patricia F. G. (left) is the leader of this group. Patricia was born in Magburaka town, northern Sierra Leone, 40 years ago. She is married to a teacher and they have four children who are attending secondary schools. Patricia sells rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), cassavas, potatoes, etc. She has been a businesswoman since her childhood days.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing basic grains, meat, dairy products and other items needed by her customers

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Our client is Carolina. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors who live in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita D. Belen D. Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. She is from Ccorao. She is 48 years old and married with three children who are studying.

She sells grains like quinoa, wheat, etc., in Huacaro and San Jeronimo, two areas of Cusco.  She buys grains from wholesalers in San Jeronimo and communities in Pisaq.  She sells approximately 150 soles worth of goods every week, which equates to $52 each week. She has been working with Arariwa, a Kiva partner, for six years and feels that Arariwa helps her and her family.

Carolina appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more grains to sell

loans.name: Maritza Martina

texts.es: La señora Maritza Martina Espinosa , tiene la edad de 43 años , habita en el barrio el Rodeo , ubicado en el municipio de La Concepción , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes , los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyar a sus hijas para que logren establecer un negocio propio , doña Maritza desde hace diez años , trabaja como comerciante de electrodoméstico para la región del RAAS   , la mayor facultad que se le presenta es el traslado de los productos , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su suegra . Agradece a Afodenic por la buena aprobación de su primer desembolso, el cual va a invertirlo para incrementar sus ventas comprara planchas, aroceras, cafetera entre otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza Martina Espinosa is 43 years hold and lives in the Rodeo neighborhood, which is in the town of La Concepción. She lives with her husband who works and helps with the household expenses. They have two children who are now older and independent. Her plan regarding her family is to be able to support her daughters build their own business. Mrs. Maritza has been working for 10 years as a domestic appliance dealer for the RAAS region. The major responsibility she has is to transport the products, and she began this work with the help of her mother-in-law. She gives thanks to Afodenic for the good approval of her first expenditure, which she will invest in the purchase of new products to sell, such as irons, rice cookers and kettles, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dozens of irons, rice cookers and kettles

loans.name: Mariano

texts.en:
Mariano is a client of Asociación Arariwa. He is a member of a communal bank that consists 15 neighbors who live in Ccorao, a town that is 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao and named after a virgin of Peru. He is from Ccorao. He is 59 years old and is married. Mariano has 6 children and 5 grandchildren.

Mariano raises cuy (guinea pigs). He prepares various dishes with cuy for tourists from Cusco when they come to buy artisan goods. He even caters government meetings and ceremonies, where he sells 30-40 cuy at one time. Each cuy costs 10-30 soles, which is the equivalent of $3.50 - $7.00 USD each. He earns about 300-400 soles, which is the equivalent of $105 - $140 USD per week. He has worked with Arariwa since 2002. He will use this loan to buy food and medicine for his cuy farm.

The video shows Mariano in one of his smaller cuy pens, where he raises 100 cuy. (The other pen holds 500 cuy.) He says he enjoys his work and that raising so many cuy is "like a sport."

Mariano appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy food and medicine for his guinea pigs

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Our client is Alicia. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors who live in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. She is from Ccorao. She is 24 years old and is married with a 3-year-old daughter.

She sells artisan-made sweaters to tourists with her husband.  She sells 100 - 400 soles, which is the equivalent of $35 – 140. She will use this loan to buy more merchandise for her store.

Alicia appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: Oscar William

texts.es: El señor Oscar William L., tiene la edad de 33 años, habita en el Km. 16 carretera hacia ticuantepe,  junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja como domestica en una casa privada , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos , actualmente estudian su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es poder brindarle comodidad a sus hijos , ya que la casa no tiene división , don Oscar desde hace dos años , se dedica a la venta de lácteos , agradece a la institución por la confianza y el apoyo que le ha brindado con este segundo crédito , lo cual con las ventas logro pagar el primer desembolso , los planes hacia un futuro es poder comprar un tramo en el mercado Oriental y ser vendedor mayorista. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de queso, crema, cuajada, y otros para incrementar las ventas y poder tener mejores ganancias para hacer los proyectos de su casa.
texts.en:
Mr Oscar William L. is 33 years old and lives along the Km. 16 highway towards Ticuantepe with his wife, who works as a domestic helping in a private home to help him with the household expenses. They have two children who are currently studying in primary school. His plans for his family is to be able to give comfort to his children because right now the house has no room division. For the past 2 years, Mr. Oscar has been selling milk, with thanks for the institution for the confidence and support that they have given him with this second loan. With the sales from this loan he will be able to pay for the first expenditure, his plan for the future is to buy a plot of land in the Oriental market and be a wholesaler. He will invest this loan in the purchase of cheese, cream, curds and other products to increase his sales and be able to make greater profit to be able to complete the projects on his house.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese milk, curds

loans.name: Blanca Segunda

texts.en:
Blanca Segunda S. A. is 42 years old and lives in the Fortin district of Guayaquil. Fortin  is a peri-urban, marginalized zone without paved roads, water pipes, or a sewer system.  Ms. S. has a mobile hair salon; her services include hairstyling, hair cuts, and hair coloring. Over the last 12 years, she has built a client base throughout Guayaquil, and she travels to their homes armed with round brushes, hair dye, blow dryers and beauty supplies.  Ms. S. and her husband dedicate a portion of their incomes to keeping their only daughter in private school.

Ms. S. is requesting a loan to purchase sheet metal to secure her roof; it is currently very fragile, making their home susceptible to harsh weather.   She is grateful for any support we can provide her family!

loans.use: to buy sheet metal to repair roof of home

loans.name: Omar Aquilino

texts.es: El señor Omar Aquilino C. Velásquez, tiene la edad de 46 años, habita en el barrio San Ignacio, ubicado en La Concepción Masaya, junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como comerciante en el mercado de Masaya para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos, todos estudian y le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace ocho años se dedica a la agricultura , ya que sus padres le brindaron la oportunidad , a la vez esta muy agradecido con Afodenic , por la buena aprobación de su primer crédito , el cual lo va a invertir en fertilizantes e insumos para inducir el cultivo de piña y poder tener una buena cosecha la cual espera vender a buen precio
texts.en:
Señor Omar Aquilino C. Velásquez is 46 and lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood, which is located in La Concepción Masaya. He lives with his wife, who works as a merchant in the market in Masaya to help him with their home's expenses. They have three children, who all study and support him with his agricultural work. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions. He has worked in agriculture for eight years, and his parents offered him this opportunity. He is very grateful to Afodenic for approving him for his first loan, which he is going to invest in fertilizers and supplies for his pineapple crop so he can have a good harvest, which he hopes to sell at a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers to apply to his crops

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca tiene 60 años, a su edad tiene la actividad económica de venta de ropa.  Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, a pesar de su edad es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y disfruta mucho de negocio. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en Fundación León 2000 pues siempre le ha gustado el servicio que le brindan. Ella dio inicio a este negocio, por su necesidad de generar ingresos ya que siempre le ha gustado ser una mujer muy independiente con su negocio. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, vestidos y ciertos trajes que son de mucha demanda por ciertos clientes. El sueño de Juana es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca is 60 years old and has been selling clothing for more than 9 years. Despite her age, she enjoys working and managing her business. Juana has been working with Fundación León 2000 for some time and has always enjoyed the service that was provided to her. She started her business out of a need to generate income. Ever since, she has always liked being an independent businesswoman.

At the moment, Juana is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy pants, shirts, dresses, and outfits that are in much demand by certain clients. Her dream is to finish the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase pants, shirts, dresses, and outfits

loans.name: Delia Amparo

texts.es: La señora Delia P. tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, y vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y la menor de sus hijas la cual estudia en un Instituto de la ciudad. Vive en el caserío de Santa Matilde perteneciente al distrito de Santiago – Ica. Tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes el cual ha logrado mantener después del terremoto ya que se vió seriamente afectada porque su casa era de adobe. Actualmente ha logrado reconstruir su casa gracias al apoyo del gobierno y su negocio lo está acondicionando nuevamente con algunos ahorros que le brinda el alquiler de un vehículo que tienen hace varios años. Además se dedica a la elaboración de comida para fiestas y compromisos sociales. Su esposo no labora ya que ha perdido la vista debido a un problema de salud. Requiere financiamiento para invertir en su bodega y poder diversificar sus productos aprovechando los meses de fiestas navideñas. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa de material  noble, hacer crecer su negocio y ayudar a su esposo con el tratamiento de su enfermedad.
texts.en:
Sra. Delia P. is 51 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her husband and three dependent daughters who attend school at an institute in the city. She resides in the village of Santa Matilide, which is in the district of Santiago – Ica. Delia manages a small grocery store. She was seriously affected by the earthquake because her house was made of adobe. Thanks to support she received from the government, she was able to rebuild her house and reestablish her business. With some savings, she acquired a vehicle that she has been renting out for several years. Delia also prepares food for parties and social engagements. Her husband is not working because he lost his sight as result of health problems.

Delia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her grocery store and diversify her products in time for the Christmas season. Her goals include finishing the construction of her house through the use of sound materials, growing her business, and helping her husband by securing treatments for his illness.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Efracia

texts.en:
Our client is Efracia. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors who live in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. Efracia is from Ccorao. She is 32 years old and is married with two children who are studying in secondary school.

Efracia is new to the group but has received other loans in the past. She has a small grocery store where she sells products like rice and sugar. She sells approximately 80 soles per day, which is roughly equivalent to $28. She will use this loan to stock her grocery store with more items.

Efracia appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Zoila Isabel

texts.es: Zoila Isabel C. es casada, Tiene 34 años de edad, es originaria de Zacapa, Guatemala. Tiene 4 hijos, su negocio es una tienda el cual la tiene hace 5 años, el negocio esta en su domicilio. Y ahora solicita un crédito por la cantidad de Q6,000.00 para poder invertir mas en su tienda y asi generar mas ingresos para su familia y poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Zoila Isabel C. is 34 years old, married, and a native of Zacapa, Guatemala. She has 4 children. Zoila operates a store out of her home and has been in business for 5 years. She is now requesting a loan of 6,000 GTQ to restock her store so that she can generate more income for her family to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her store with everyday consumer products

loans.name: Cruz Donal

texts.es: Cruz Donal tiene 55 años, el es un hombre casado y junto a su pareja tienen 5 hijos mayores de edad. Su actividad económica es una librería, hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y mantener a su familia. Su negocio inicio porque él no tenía un trabajo estable y necesitaba proporcionarle a su familia el alimento diario, por lo que empezó por esfuerzo propio. Actualmente el solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de hojas blancas, folder, tijeras, lapiceros, borrador y calculadoras. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio lo suficiente para sobresalir más que la competencia.
texts.en:
Cruz Donal is 55 years old, married, and has 5 adult children. He has been managing a bookstore for more than 8 years. He enjoys working and supporting his family. With much effort, Cruz started his business because he did not have stable job and needed to provide for his family’s daily needs.

He is currently requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy copy paper, folders, scissors, pencils, erasers, and calculators. He hopes to expand his business so that he will be able to surpass the competition.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase copy paper, folders, scissors, pencils, erasers, and calculators

loans.name: Santos Francisco

texts.es: El señor Santos Francisco C. es originario del municipio de santa María Chichuimula del departamento de Totonicapán hace dos años contrajo matrimonio con la señora Magdalena Vicenta, actualmente con residencia  final zona uno del municipio de Totonicapán su principal actividad es la compra y ventas de animales domésticos su principal lugar de compra en San Francisco el Alto del municipio de Totonicapán, lugar de venta en San Cristóbal, y Totonicapán actualmente necesita de un crédito que le servirá para ampliar su capital y aprovechar la época de fin de año  donde las ventas incrementas y con las ganancias que obtiene le permitirá  mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos Francisco C. is originally from the town of Santa María Chichuimula in the department of Totonicapán. He and his wife of two years, Sra. Magdalena Vicenta, currently live in District #1 of the department of Totonicapán. His business involves buying and selling domesticated animals. Santos acquires his animals in San Francisco el Alto, a town in Totonicapán, and then sells them in San Cristóbal and Totonicapán.

He is currently requesting a loan to increase his capital so that he will be able to take advantage of the year-end season when his sales increase. Santos hopes that the earnings he generates will allow him to improve his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his operating capital to buy more animals

loans.name: Sandra Bertilia

texts.es: La señora  Sandra  es  originaria  del municipio de Totonicapán su principal fuente de ingreso  es bordado a maquina  sus principales puntos de ventas son Salcaja, San Francisco el Alto  y Totonicapán, actualmente necesita un crédito  que será invertido para la remodelación de su vivienda , que consiste en la construcción de un pequeño taller ya que programado para el mes de marzo  contar con dos operarais y con ello poder mejora su producción y como su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Sandra is from the municipality of Totonicapán. Her principal source of income is machine embroidery. Her main points of sale are Salcaja, San Francisco el Alto and Totonicapán. Currently, she needs a loan that will be invested in the remodeling her house, which will involve the construction of a small workshop since in the month of March she is planning on budgeting for two workers and with them be able to improve her production and standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe De Jesús A. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudar a crecer más si negocio.  
El cliente solicita nueva mente un préstamo para la compra de una rostizadora de pollo ya que en el lugar que tiene ubicado su negocio, nada más hay la venta de pollo asado. Desean adquirir la rostizadora con capacidad de 45 pollos, el cual estará afuera de su negocio, para que la gente que pase a su negocio vea y los pollos rostizados y listos para comer, acampañados de sus tortillas de maíz y su salsita mmmmmmm que rico.  
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias de la nueve inversión en el negocio ya que saben que es algo que su va a funcionar.
texts.en:
Sra. Guadalupe De Jesús A. is very grateful for the assistance of her previous loan, which helped her increase her business.

She is requesting a new loan to buy a chicken broiler for her business because no other places in her area sell roasted chickens. Guadalupe hopes to acquire a broiler that can hold 45 chickens. She plans to put the broiler outside of her business so that people passing by can see the rotisserie chickens and be enticed to come inside and eat. The chickens will be served with corn tortillas and her delicious salsa.

Guadalupe plans to repay the loan using the earnings that result from this new business investment. She is confident that this idea is going to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a chicken broiler

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el Mercado El Bisne del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Juana V. se dedica a su actividad de elaboración y venta de tortillas siendo elaboradas por ella misma y también tiene una joven que le ayuda a elaborar las tortillas. (En la fotografía la señora Juana aparece a la derecha y a la izquierda su ayudante).

La señora Juana atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su actividad y para ello es que solicita un crédito para la compra de la materia prima como lo es el maíz para continuar elaborando las deliciosas tortillas y ofreciéndolas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
At the Bisne Market in Chinandega, Sra. Juana V. sells tortillas that she makes herself. She also hired a young woman to help her with making tortillas. (In the photograph, Sra. Juana appears on the right and her assistant is on the left.)

Sra. Juana needs to invest in her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients, such as corn, so that she can continue producing delicious tortillas to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn for making tortillas

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es: El joven Gustavo es originario de la comunidad de Chotacaj su principal fuente de ingreso lo obtiene como receptor pagador del banco BANRURAL  viene trabjando hace tres años hoy necesita el apoyo de la institucion ASDIR en un credito que sera invertido para culminar sus estudios universitarios, para poder tener mayor acceso ser competivo en el mercado academico
texts.en:
Young Gustavo is originally from the community of Chotacaj. His main source of income is from his job as a bank teller at BANRURAL. He has been working for three years and now needs assistance from Asociación ASDIR. This loan will help Gustavo complete his university studies, which will help him become competitive in the marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University expenses

loans.name: Cynthia Paola

texts.es:
La señora Cynthia Paola es madre soltera ya que hace años atrás se separo de su marido por situaciones personales, ella tiene 2 hijas en edad escolar. Labora para una residencia en el área de labores domesticas desde hace 3 años, y por mes recibe una pensión alimenticia que le proporciona su ex pareja para gastos de las niñas.
Ella esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de uniformes escolares de temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Cynthia Paola is a single mother who has been separated from her husband for years due to personal reasons. She has two school-aged daughters. She has been working for as a housekeeper in a private residence for the last three years, and each month she receives child allowance from her ex-husband. She is applying for this loan to buy winter school uniforms for her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Amanda Paulina

texts.es: Amanda tiene 20 años, vive en casa de los padres de su pareja con su niña de 3 años de edad. Amanda hace 2 años se inicio en el negocio de la venta de ropa y calzados, capital prestado por su padres de ella, en las temporadas navideñas incursiona en la venta de juguetes la cual le genera ingresos adicionales a su hogar. Amanda realiza las ventas de su mercadería como recorredora (personas que ofrecen la mercadería en el domicilio de las personas), a los cuales les brinda un trato muy calido y agradable motivo por el cual ha ido incrementándose su clientela, los cuales le realizan mayores pedidos de ropa, calzados y otros accesorios, la mayoría de sus clientes son de la misma zona donde ella vive, solicita el crédito para la compra de la mercadería que ofrecerá en la temporada navideña. Amanda no culmino la secundaria por diversos motivos, el sueño de Amanda es culminar con sus estudios, contar con una casa propia y poder tener su propio negocio el cual le generara mayores ingresos los cuales les permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Amanda is 20 years old. She lives in her partner’s parents’ house with their 3 year-old daughter. Two years ago, Amanda started a business selling clothing and shoes with capital lent to her by her parents. During the Christmas season she also sells toys, which generates additional income for her household. Amanda makes her sales as a door-to-door sales person (she sells merchandise to people in their homes). She is friendly and agreeable toward her customers, so she has been gaining clients who make larger orders of clothing, shoes, and other accessories. The majority of her customers are from the same neighborhood where she lives. She is requesting a loan so she can buy the merchandise that she offers during the Christmas season. Amanda did not finish high school for a variety of reasons. Amanda’s dream is to finish her studies, have her own house, and to have her own business that will generate greater income, which would allow her to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toys for the upcoming Christmas season

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en: Cerelina D. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Cerelina owns and operates a business providing general clothing services to the whole community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Aside from this, she is also into a food-making and selling business. She wants to make a good income from these businesses. In 2009, Cerelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale as well as maintenance for her sewing equipment. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale and to maintain her sewing equipment

loans.name: Ralph

texts.en: Ralph D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 26 years old and is single. Ralph owns and operates a business providing transport services to local community members using his "habal-habal" (a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers). He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ralph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ralph is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Rezan

texts.en:
Rezan P. is from the village of Plaridel St. Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Rezan is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rezan runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rezan has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rezan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rezan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rezan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana A. is from the village of Upper Cogon, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old. Luciana is widowed and has adult-aged children. To make a living, Luciana runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Luciana has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luciana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luciana is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luciana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa T. appreciates life on the farm. She started growing rice in 1996.  Now she is still doing the same thing because, aside from this being her livelihood, she finds a great joy looking at the rice plants and harvesting the golden colored rice grains. She has a 16-year-old child. She has been doing the very best she can do to be able to improve the size of her harvest to save money for the education of her child and pay the daily expenses of their home. 

She would like to grow a bigger harvest. By applying a loan of PHP 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc, she has a bigger chance of improving her harvest. The loan will be used to buy farming necessities. In this way, she will be able to have an abundant harvest and income.

loans.use: To buy farm necessities

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou T. is from the village of Catibac, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Marilou is single. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a business providing sing-a-long services to local community members. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth T. has been a rice grower for quite a long time now. She grew up on the farm so that even when she was just a small kid, she was already familiar with the process from planting to harvest. She married a farmer. Her husband manages the farm. The harvest is what they use to pay the daily expenses in their home. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. This loan will go far in buying all the farming necessities. Receiving this loan is a big help to her to provide her family a bountiful harvest and better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy farm necessities

loans.name: Mr. Chouch Pov Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan group consists of sixteen people and they all live in Dak Por village in Kandal province. Mr. Chouch P. is the village bank president, and has been selected by the group members. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. He also breeds pigs and chickens to earn money. His wife, Mrs. H. Nakry, is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. As her business is going well, she wants to expand it. This is the reason that Mr. Chouch P., 27 years old, decided to ask for a loan, to buy more grocery goods for to sell. He hopes to increase their income and to improve his wife’s business with this loan. He is father of two children who are still too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for selling.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina M. is from the village of Danao. She is 34 years old. Lina is single. To make a living, Lina owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lina has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Lina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Lina is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Lina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang H. lives in An Doung Samreth village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder and is involved in the sale of duck eggs. Since her poultry business is going well, she wants to expand it to earn more income. Thus, she decided to buy 600 ducklings and duck food for her poultry business. Her husband, Mr. Chea Ouch, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates both rice and vegetables. Mrs. Neang H. is 28 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy 600 ducklings and duck food for her poultry business.

loans.name: Emenciana

texts.en:
Emenciana V. is from the village of Kinuman Sur Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 71 years old. Emenciana is widowed and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Emenciana owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emenciana has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Emenciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emenciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emenciana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Emenciana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Evancy

texts.en:
Evancy B. is from the village of Alegria. She is 31 years old. Evancy is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evancy owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Evancy has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Evancy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Evancy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Evancy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina N., 41 years old, seems to be an unstoppable entrepreneur.  Her husband Rodrigo, 44, a hardworking man, is an electrician.  They have three children; two are enrolled in college and the youngest is in high school.

Flordelina, to her credit, has a number of businesses.  She manages a tricycle transport.  She also sells electronic load credits for mobile phones, which have now become a necessity for people.  In addition, she makes and sells peanut butter and she buys and sells pork and chicken.  All these, when combined, give Flordelina a sure monthly income of P13,700.00 a month.  Her profits are enough to support her children’s education.

Since joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in September 2006, Flordelina has been enjoying its many benefits for its members, who are mostly housewives.  She is now on her 10th loan cycle with CCT.  She is expecting to receive a fresh loan from the cooperative in the amount of P22,000.00, which she will divide amongst her businesses as additional capital. 

The couple wishes to see all their children finish their college education.


About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen G. is from the village of Zone 13 Puli, Silver Creek, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old. Gretchen is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gretchen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products such as chips, beverages, shampoos, candies and others in the local community. Gretchen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gretchen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gretchen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Gretchen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gretchen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en: Feliza P. is from the village of Clarin. She is 61 years old, is widowed, and has five adult children. Feliza owns and operates a business making & selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2003, Feliza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Feliza is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena G. is from the village of Zone 1, Camarahan, Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 56 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Nena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Nena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Nena is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: This is Arlyn B., a young businesswoman who lives among the poor communities in Parola, Tondo, Manila. She is 33 years old and her husband, Emilio, 35, works for a construction firm. They have six children: the eldest is in high school, four are in grade school, and the youngest stays at home. Arlene started cooking and selling food items and other goodies to her neighbors last year. She sells rice cakes, finger foods, snacks, burgers and fruit shakes and earns close to P10,000 a month. Her earnings answer for their daily basic needs. Arlene is now in need of a loan of P8,000 to buy food ingredients. She is also set to buy a small grill for cooking burgers. She dreams of having her own permanent place of business, more like a restaurant. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 41 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a general store with her husband (pictured) where they sell cooking oil, water, cola, rice, tuna, and treats. Recently, they expanded the back of the store to make room for tailoring services by Azucena.

They would like to use this loan to replace their cane home with a sturdier and safer alternative (either bricks or cement). The couple also aims to promote their tailor shop for the upcoming holidays.

loans.use: to buy bricks/cement to build a sturdy house

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
"The ultimate goal of every couple is to build a happy family having all their needs met so they can enjoy the essence of life," said Violeta.  She and her husband are doing their best to meet their needs and give their children a better future.  

Farming is their main source of income. They plant rice and vegetables twice in a year. Furthermore,  Violeta engages in retailing rice in their village to earn additional income since harvest time takes a long time. She is requesting for $175 a loan from the KIVA lenders to purchase rice for re-selling in the Solano public market. She needs to earn more income to finance the education of her children. Their schooling costs more now that they are in higher levels of learning. She hopes that with patience and sacrifices, she will improve her small business and give their children a better future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for re-selling

In 2009, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a loan of $125, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

Nympha has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

Nympha is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nympha from HSPFI. location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Babyruth

texts.en: This is Babyruth Jabiñar, a businesswoman from Pasay City. Her husband, Epifanio, 38, works overseas. They have four children: one is in college, two are in high school, and the youngest is in grade school. Babyruth’s general store is very new – it started four months ago yet is already earning close to P20,000 a month. She sells different accessories. She hires one youngster to attend to her business. Babyruth became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005. She has applied for a new loan of P21,000 to beef-up her store by stocking more accessories to sell. It has always been her aim to send her child to college and that is why she has been working hard day and night. She also wishes to put up a computer shop soon. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
“If you are honest, God will grant your request.” This is the guiding principle of Sabina. She and her family live in the village of Uddiawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. Being responsible parents, she and her husband want their children to have a bright future. Hence, they are doing all they can to earn and support their children’s schooling.

Sabina’s husband works as a janitor at the municipal office of Villaverde while Sabina helps her husband by earning a living selling frozen foods in their village, selling her products through house-to-house delivery. Every week, she can earn a net income of PHP 1,050 which she carefully budgets to provide for their basic needs and to finance the schooling of their children.

After a year of sacrifice, all of their three children graduated from college. Two of them are presently working abroad while the youngest is engaged in her own business.

Sabina wants to continue her business to earn and save for their future. This is the reason why she decided to borrow PHP 8,000 from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios M., 41 years old, is a rice farmer. She owns a small rice field, which is being managed by her husband, Nestor M.. She has a 22-year-old child who, instead of going to school to study, helps her grow rice. Their livelihood revolves around the land that they till. Their harvest is what they use to buy the basic needs of their home.

She plans to expand her business even more. She needs additional capital of PHP 9,000 to sustain her livelihood. Availing a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. will be a big help for her to ensure a quality harvest from her farm because she will buy all the farming necessities with her loan.

loans.use: To buy farm necessities

loans.name: Carmita Condoy

texts.en:
Carmita is 40 years old and married with two children. She owns a retail store in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil, a peri-urban marginalized zone. Currently she sells clothes, DVDs, and beauty supplies.

This loan will be used to buy more DVDs for her shop. In the future, Carmita would like to manage and develop the land next to her DVD shop. She will be saving any future income to make this goal a reality!

loans.use: To buy more DVDs for her shop

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline S. is from the village of Lawigan, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Jacqueline is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jacqueline owns & operates a business peddling food including snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Jacqueline has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jacqueline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacqueline is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be used to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es una mujer de 36 años, su deseo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos lo necesario para su educación, además que dentro de casa también trata de inculcarles buenos principios.

Desde que se separó de su esposo tuvo que desempeñarse en diversas actividades y una de ellas es la venta de cosméticos, labor que siempre le agradó. Bertha considera que las relacionarse interpersonales son la base de su negocio, pues cada persona que conoce, se convierte en su cliente. 
Sin embargo, lo difícil de este negocio es recorrer diversos lugares en busca de nuevos clientes, por lo que tiene que caminar mucho y tocar varias puertas.
Sus planes a futuro son de conseguir un local donde pueda instalar una tienda para vender accesorios para damas, pues es una de las actividades más rentables en su localidad.

Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, por tanto desea trabajar con responsabilidad para no defraudar la confianza depositada en su persona. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará materiales navideños para realizar adornos artesanales y venderlos a sus clientas de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Bertha is a 36 year old woman who desires to improve her living conditions. She also wants to provide her two children with an education and a home where she can instill in them good principles.

Since separating from her husband, Bertha has had to take on numerous jobs with one of them being the sale of cosmetics. She has always enjoyed this type of work. Bertha finds that interpersonal relationships are the foundation of her business because she is able to convert anyone she meets into a customer. However, her work is difficult because she has to travel to different places in search of new customers. This requires a lot of walking and knocking on many doors. Her future plans include opening a shop where she can sell women’s accessories, since this is one of the most profitable types of businesses in her area.

Bertha is taking her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Therefore, she is willing to work responsibly so that she does not betray the trust that was placed in her. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase materials for making Christmas ornaments and handicrafts and selling them to the customers who already buy cosmetics from her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making Christmas ornaments & handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 38 años, ella es muy alegre y amorosa con su familia, a quienes desea brindar seguridad económica.

La venta de cosméticos es una de las actividades que más oportunidades le ha brindado, pues le era difícil ajustarse a los horarios de trabajos en otras labores sin descuidar a sus hijos. Por ello optó por dedicarse a vender cosméticos, teniendo muy buena acogida por sus vecinos y amigos, quienes se acostumbraron a realizar sus pedidos cada fin de mes, lo cual incrementaron sus ganas de seguir dedicándose al comercio.
Carmen considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio está en aprovechar las ofertas de los catálogos, para así vender los productos con otro costo que le ayude a incrementar sus ingresos.
Su deseo a futuro es de instalar un stand en algún mercado de su localidad, donde venda cómodamente, sin tener que movilizarse a distintos lugares.

Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y se siente muy contenta de formar parte de un bonito equipo de trabajo dentro de su banco comunal junto a sus vecinas, quienes también están muy comprometidas con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita incrementar sus productos de belleza para aprovechar la demanda que habrá en las festividades próximas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old. She is a cheerful woman who adores her family, for whom she wants to provide financial security.

Selling cosmetics provided Carmen with many opportunities because she found it difficult adjusting to the work schedules of most jobs without having to neglect her children. Her products have been well-received by friends and neighbors, who usually place their orders by the end of each month. As her sales increased, Carmen became more motivated to continue with her business.

She believes selling cosmetics can be very profitable because she takes advantage of catalog offers. Selling products that are bundled with other items have helped to increase her earnings. In the future, Carmen would like to open a stand at one of the local markets so that she can manage her business comfortably without having to travel to different places.

This is her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Carmen is very excited of be part of a nice Communal Bank team in which she gets to work with her neighbors. The members are also very committed to the development of their group. She will use the money she requested to increase her supply of beauty products so that she can take advantage of the higher demand expected during the upcoming festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her supply of merchandise

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia T. is 33 years old. She is a mother and a farmer from Kapatungan, Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She has a rice field, which she hopes will provide her family with food and income. She is also engaged in duck raising. She already has 200 ducks. She expects that number to grow so that she will be able to support all her family's needs. 

She plans to expand her business but needs additional capital to do so. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farming necessities to improve her harvest and household income.

loans.use: To buy farm necessities

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo P. is from the village of Sinara Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 50 years old. Danilo is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Danilo owns & operates a motorcycle transport services. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Danilo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for repair and maintenance. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Danilo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For repair and maintenance of his motorcycle

Flor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Flor is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Flor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.name: Carmen Flores

texts.en:
Carmen is not married and is 59 years old. She has 6 children, the youngest of whom still lives with her. She sells soft drinks, fruit, soaps, shampoo, and beauty accessories.

A short time ago, some burglars tried to rob her business because the store’s door isn’t very strong and can’t protect well against thieves. She tends to her store from 6:30am until 10:30pm, so she is very afraid of being assaulted. With the new loan, she plans to make the doors of her business and house more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen es una señora soltera de 59 años, tienes 6 hijos, el menor de sus hijos aun vive con ella. Su actividad principal es la venta de Colas, frutas, jabones, shampoo y acceserios de belleza.

Hace poco tiempo los ladrones quisieron robarle en su negocio porque la puerta de la tienda no es muy fuerte y no la protege mucho de los ladrones. Ella atiende de 6:30 a.m. hasta las 22h30 y por su horario siente mucho temor de ser asaltada. Con el rendimiento del nuevo prestamo planea asegurar las puertas de su negocio y su casa.

loans.use: To protect her house and improve security at her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina L. is from the village of Purok 3 San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Gina is married and has three school-aged children.
