To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business selling daily use products such as shampoos, detergent soaps & toothpastes in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer de 54 años, ella es muy trabajadora y su mayor deseo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Vive con sus 5 hijos quienes le brindan su apoyo incondicional.

Desde muy joven trabajó vendiendo diversos accesorios para damas, pero cuando se casó dejo de trabajar con el fin de atender su hogar. Sin embargo, la muerte de su pareja la obligó a retomar su actividad comercial, y desde hace 10 años viene trabajando en la venta de cosméticos y ropa, labor que realiza con mucha alegría, brindado a sus clientes una atención de calidad. 
Dora considera que lo rentable de su actividad depende de la compra, al por mayor, de los productos, además de las ofertas que hay en los catálogos, pues después de un tiempo puede venderlos a los precios habituales. 
Sus planes a futuro son de implementar una tienda de accesorios de belleza y productos cosméticos, en su misma vivienda.

Este es su primer préstamo individual con Microfinanzas PRISMA, anteriormente fue parte de un banco comunal, por lo que sabe que siendo puntual en sus pagos tendrá la posibilidad de seguir accediendo a otros créditos, los cuales le brinden la oportunidad de seguir mejorando como comerciante. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará grandes cantidades de productos de belleza para venderlos en estas próximas festividades navideñas.
texts.en:
Dora is 54 years old. She is a hardworking woman whose greatest wish is to improve her living conditions. She lives with her 5 children who provide her with unconditional support.

Since she was a young woman, Dora has been selling women’s accessories but stopped working when she got married so that she could take care of the household. However, the death of her husband forced her to resume working. She has now been selling cosmetics and clothing for 10 years. Dora takes great joy in her work and provides her customers with quality service.

She considers her line of work to be profitable because she can purchase her products at wholesale through catalogs and then sell them at retail prices. Her future plans include opening a store out of her home where she sells cosmetics and beauty accessories.

This is Dora’s first individual loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She was previously a member of a Communal Bank, so she knows that she has to make her payments on time in order to be eligible for future loans and have the opportunity to grow as a businesswoman. With the money she requested, Dora will purchase large quantities of beauty products to sell during the upcoming holiday festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda H. lives and does business in Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila.  She is 55 years old.  Her husband Benjamin, 59, works on a school maintenance crew.  One of their six children is now in college.

Erlinda has been selling rice cakes and homemade peanut butter for five years.  Then she opened a general store almost two years ago.  Combined, she earns more than P18,000.00 a month.  She has hired one store assistant.  

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the summer of 2007.  She recently applied for a P18, 000.00 loan with CCT as additional capital for her business.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 50 años es un hombre muy trabajador y comprometido con el progreso de su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus 3 hijos, por quienes se sacrifica todos los días por ofrecerles lo mejor.

Desde muy joven le agradó el arte, pero sobretodo la música, por lo que hace 10 años conformó una agrupación junto a algunas amistades con quienes compartía la misma pasión, y se dedicaron tocar en eventos especiales, haciéndose conocidos con el paso del tiempo.
Edwin considera que su actividad musical es muy rentable, pues sólo toca los fines de semana y tiene tiempo para realizar otros trabajos, como algunos servicios a computadora, ganando  ingresos adiciones. 
Para el futuro desea comprar más instrumentos musicales y así seguir mejorando los equipos que sonido que tiene, los cuales son muy necesarios dentro de su trabajo.

Este es su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, él sabe que con su trabajo y con sus pagos puntuales seguirá mejorando su línea de crédito con su banco comunal, del cual es parte desde hace 5 años. Con el dinero que ahora solicita planea comprar otra computadora para seguir trabajando en su casa prestando servicios de mecanografiado a sus vecinos estudiantes.
texts.en:
Edwin is 50 years old and a hardworking man who is committed to his family’s success. He has a wife and three children, for whom he makes sacrifices every day to provide them the best.

Edwin enjoyed art as kid, especially music. Ten years ago, he formed a group with some of his friends who share the same passion. They play at special events and have become well-known over time. Edwin considers his musical career to be very profitable. He only performs on the weekends, so he has time for other jobs, such as providing computer services, in order to earn additional income. In the future, he wants to buy more musical instruments so that he can improve the sound of his existing equipment, which is necessary for his line of work.

This is Edwin’s eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. He knows that his work and his timely payments improve the line of credit he has with his Communal Bank, which he has been a member of for the past 5 years. The money he is requesting will be used to buy another computer so that he can continue working from home providing desktop publishing services to students in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida C. is from the village of Upper Langcangan Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Zenaida is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a "sari-sari" retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Zenaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Zenaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana L. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Bibiana is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Bibiana owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products such as candies, chips, beverages, soaps, shampoos and others in the local community. Bibiana has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bibiana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bibiana is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bibiana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia L. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old. Eugenia is separated from her spouse and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Eugenia owns & operates a business selling fish in the local market and to local members in the community. Her husband is a fisherman so she sells the fish he catches. Eugenia has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eugenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eugenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Eugenia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of income of Roberto and his family. He is married to Anita and they are blessed with two children: Russel - 12 years old, an elementary student, and Hannah - 5 years old.

Roberto and his family reside in the village of Pangal Norte, Echague, Isabela. He would like to buy farm supplies to enable him to have a higher yield. For this reason, he would like to apply for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase the needed items.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana tiene 53 años, su gran sentido del humor y sus deseos de superación le ayudaron a mejorar sus condiciones de vida dentro de su hogar, el cual está conformado por su madre anciana y su hijo de 30 años, quien la ayuda con las labores de su casa.

La venta de ropa es una de las actividades que le gusta desde muy joven, pues siempre le agradó vestir bien y con el paso del tiempo su madre la motivó a vender prendas de vestir. Desde entonces, hace 6 años se dedica a repartir los pedidos que sus clientes realizan cada fin de mes, atendiendo su negocio desde su domicilio, siendo sus amigos y vecinos sus principales clientes.
Eliana considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio está en aprovechar las promociones que realizan los diversos supermercados, donde adquiere prendas de calidad con la finalidad de revenderlas a precios más altos. 
Sus planes a futuro son de mejorar la atención a sus clientes, instalando un pequeño stand en su vivienda, además de ofrecer variedad en prendas y de buena calidad.

Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está segura que la responsabilidad y compromiso en sus pagos garantizarán su trabajo. Con el dinero que solicita tendrá la posibilidad de incrementar su mercadería en ropa y aprovechará las liquidaciones por temporada.
texts.en:
Eliana is 53 years old and has a great sense of humor. Her desire to overcome enabled her to improve the living conditions for her family, which consists of her elderly mother and her 30 year old son who helps with the work around the house.

Selling clothes was one of the jobs she enjoyed as a young woman. Eliana always liked to dress well and over time her mother encouraged her to sell clothes. For six years, she has been distributing orders that her customers place at the end of each month. She manages her business from home, with her friends and neighbors being her main customers.

Eliana believes her business can be profitable by taking advantage of sales at various retail stores that acquire quality garments with the intention of selling them at higher prices. In the future, she plans to improve the service to her customers, open a small stand in her home, and offer a variety of high-quality articles of clothing.

This is Eliana’s first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She is committed to being responsible and making her payments. With the money she is requesting, she plans to increase her inventory of clothing by taking advantage of seasonal clearance sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim N. is a villager in Damnak Sangke village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land in which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a fish breeder. Since her fish breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fish and fish food for the fishery. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. Mrs. Sim N. is a 62 year old widow, her child is a construction worker.

loans.use: By purchasing more fish and fish food for her fishery.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn S. is from the village of Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Evelyn owns and operates a cross-stitch business, selling cross-stitch products. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cross-stitch products and to expand her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cross-stitch products

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 69 años, muy optimista y trabajadora. Sus más ansiados deseos son de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, pues vive sola en la casa que heredó de sus padres, y trabaja pensando en tener una vejez tranquila.

Desde muy joven supo aprovechar el tiempo trabajando en diversas actividades que le dieron la posibilidad de invertir en la instalación de una tienda de comestibles en su casa, donde trabaja por más de 27 años, tiempo en que logró consolidar  su local como uno de los más concurridos de su localidad. 
Julia considera que su bodega es rentable por el tiempo que tiene de funcionamiento y por la calidad de productos que brinda, sumado a la buena atención que encuentran sus clientes al momento de realizar sus compras. 
Es por ello que sus deseos de mejorar son siempre continuos, pues la demanda va en aumento y es necesario instalar nuevos estantes de venta para facilitar los pedidos de sus clientes.

Este es su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y al igual que sus compañeras de banco comunal trabaja con mucho esmero en busca de la prosperidad de su negocio. Con el dinero que ahora solicita espera comprar productos nuevos por la campaña navideña que esta próxima.
texts.en:
Julia is a 69-year-old woman who is very optimistic and hard working. Her greatest desire is to improve her standard of living, since she lives alone in the house that she inherited from her parents, and works so that she can have a peaceful old age. Ever since Julia was very young she has known how to make the most of her time by working in different activities, which gave her the opportunity to invest in setting up a grocery store in her home. She has worked in her store for more than 27 years, and during that time her store has grown to become one of the busiest in her town. Julia thinks that her store is profitable because of the amount of time that she has been in business and because of the quality of the products that she offers, in addition to the good customer service that she provides her customers when they are making their purchases. Julia is always wishing to improve her business, since the demand is increasing and she needs to install new shelves so she can facilitate her customers’ orders. This is Julia’s eighth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas PRISMA, and just like her colleagues at her communal bank, she works hard so that she can prosper in her business. She is hoping to use the money she is requesting to purchase new products for the Christmas holiday season, which is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise for the Christmas holiday season

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en: Elvera A. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 55 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Elvera owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elvera joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Elvera is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Remigia

texts.en:
Remigia is engaged in a direct-selling business and, at the same time, manages their rice fields. She is happily married to Delfin and they are blessed with three children: Lexington - 27 years old, a college graduate; Loraine - 18 years old, at college level; and Lexter - 13 years old, a high school student.

Remigia and Delfin are striving hard to sustain all the needs of their family. Her direct selling business is improving and she wants to buy more products due to the demands of her customers. For this reason, she would like to request financial support from Kiva lenders of PHP 15,000. The loan will be used to purchase more products and for the maintenance of their farm. She is hoping that she will be able to obtain the loan amount she is requesting.

Remigia is looking forward for her family needs. She is praying that she will be able to continue to support her children until they finish their college education.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her rice-farming and direct-selling businesses

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sophal O. is the group leader of a six members loan group who all live in Reussei SrO. village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Un Sotum, sell bananas in the local market. Since this business is going well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sophal O. decided to request a loan to buy more bananas to resell to earn more income to support the family’s standard of living. She is 42 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita M. is from the village of Grace Village, Sto. Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 59 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Rosita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 45 años, se caracteriza por su perseverancia y sus deseos de superación, los cuales siempre la identificaron en la localidad donde reside desde hace 20 años junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos.

El don que ella tiene es la cocina, desde muy joven fue reconocida por su sabrosa sazón y sus amistades comenzaron a solicitar sus servicios para algunos eventos o celebraciones sociales. 
Desde entonces, inició su negocio de venta de comida y hace pocos meses pudo instalar un comedor popular donde albergara a gran cantidad de personas de su localidad y atiende con la ayuda de algunas vecinas. 
María considera rentable su trabajo debido al bajo costo que invierte en la preparación de los alimentos y a la demanda que hay en el lugar. Por ello, sus planes a futuro son de seguir implementando su comedor con algunos muebles necesarios para la comodidad de sus comensales, quienes cada día van en aumento.

Este es su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, ella sabe que la responsabilidad en sus cuotas respalda el trabajo que realiza y el compromiso que tiene con su banco comunal, al cual pertenece por más de 5 años. Con el dinero que ahora solicita podrá invertir en la compra de mercadería (comestibles) que requiere para seguir preparando sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en:
María, 45 years old, is characterized by her perseverance and her strong desire for self-improvement. She is identified by these traits in the town where she has lived for the past 20 years with her husband and three children. María is a very gifted cook. Ever since she was very young, she has been known for her food's delicious flavors. Her friends began to ask for her services for social events and celebrations. Ever since then, she has run her business of cooking and selling food. A few months ago, she was able to open a popular diner where many members of the community go to eat; she serves them with the help of a few of her neighbors. María considers her business to be profitable because the cost of food supplies is low and the demand of her product is high. For these reasons, her future plans are to continue furnishing the diner with some additional tables and chairs for the comfort of her customers, whose number seems to grow every day. This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She knows that the responsibility of her payments supports the work that she does and the commitment that she has with her community bank, where she has been a member for more than 5 years. With the money she is asking for now, she would be able to invest in the purchase of merchandise (foodstuffs) that she needs in order to continue preparing her tasty dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of foodstuffs for the preparation of her dishes

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Sibugon Lopez, in Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Erlinda is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business in the retail sector operating a "sari-sari" retail store. Her main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari" retail store.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou C. is from the village of Lauigan, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Marilou is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a business in the retail sector making operating a variety store.  Her main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling variety of products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y optimista. Vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos, quienes son su mayor tesoro.

Desde que sus hijos crecieron ella buscó la manera que apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Para ello, adquirió un carrito (móvil) de comida, con el cual trabaja todas las tardes en la puerta de su casa, instalándose en un espacio provisional para atender a sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son sus vecinos. 
Esta actividad la viene realizando por 5 años y en el corto tiempo ha sabido captar la atención de las personas y conocer los gustos de sus clientes. La rentabilidad de su negocio está en la compra de los productos que requiere para cocinar a un bajo precio y en la preparación, pues las personas reconocen la exquisita sazón que tiene María. 
Sus planes a futuro son de ampliar su casa e instalar un  restaurante  donde atienda por las tardes y noches, pues la venta  de comida es mayormente en esos horarios, con miras a este deseo, viene construyendo poco a poco su casa pensando en cada detalle de su negocio.

Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y se siente muy comprometida con la institución, pues su interés es seguir progresando en base a su trabajo, dedicación y a los posteriores créditos que piensa solicitar. Con el dinero que ahora solicita planea incrementar la cantidad de porciones de comida que ofrece, además de comprar algunos muebles para ampliar su pequeño puesto.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old. She is a hardworking and optimistic woman who lives with her husband and 3 children, who are her greatest treasure.

Since her children are grown, María looked for a way to help her husband with the household expenses. She bought a mobile food cart that she situated in a temporary space in front of her home. María works every evening and most of her customers are her neighbors. She has been in business for 5 years and, within a short time, has managed to capture people’s attention and figure out what her customers like to eat. Her business is profitable because she is able to purchase her supplies at a low price and prepare the food efficiently. People have come to recognize the exquisite taste of María’s dishes.

Her future plans include expanding her house so that she can open a restaurant. It would be open in the afternoons and evenings, since this is when she sells the most food. With this dream in mind, she will pursue these improvements gradually so that she can pay attention to the details required for her future business.

This is María’s first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She is committed to the Institution and making further progress in her work because she intends to apply for future loans. With the money she is requesting at the moment, María plans to increase the quantity of food that she offers and purchase some furniture for her small vending stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & some furniture for her vending stand

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
53 years old Flordelina M. owns a 1 and 1/4 hectare farm. Her 22-year-old child was not able to go to college due to the lack of family income. Her family cannot afford the tuition because it is very expensive and their earnings are very low.  Like any other businesspersons, she desired to be successful in her business. She wants to prosper with her farm and make it more productive to support the daily needs. 

Flordelina would like to ask for a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her business. Receiving this loan is truly worthwhile because this will help her improve her harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Liway

texts.en:
34-year-old Liway M. (with her child in the photo) grows rice for a living. All her life has been spent on the farm. The harvest she gets from her farm is saved for the family's consumption. The remainders are sold to other people for additional income for the family. 

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farming needs, and pay the rental of the equipment they will use for farm land preparation. This will ensure a quality and abundant harvest in her farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa tiene 26 años, su gran carisma y su entusiasmo están basados en el amor que tiene a sus padres, por quienes viene trabajando arduamente con el fin de apoyarlos en los gastos dentro de casa.

Desde que terminó sus estudios en el colegio decidió trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, pero sobre todo para pagar sus estudios superiores, los cuales son muy importantes para ella. Desde entonces trabaja en la librería que instaló en la casa de sus padres, donde atiende todos los días con mucho humor y amabilidad a sus clientes. 
Melissa considera que la venta de útiles escolares es muy rentable debido a la cercanía que su casa tiene con un centro educativo. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo en tratar con jóvenes y niños, quienes siempre alegran sus días con comentarios agradables, pero lo difícil es conseguir proveedores que ofrezcan productos de calidad a precios justos que favorezcan a su negocio. Sus planes a futuro son de mejorar su local con productos novedosos y útiles para todo estudiante.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y sabe que su responsabilidad dentro su banco comunal es indispensable para seguir trabajando junto a sus compañeras. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más útiles escolares para vender en estos últimos meses del año.
texts.en:
Melissa is 26 years old. Her charisma and enthusiasm stem from the love she has for her parents. She works hard so that she can help them with the household expenses.

After she completed her college education, Melissa decided to work in order to help her parents. Before that, she paid her way through college, which was a priority for her. She opened a bookstore out of her parents’ home. Melissa looks after her business every day and welcomes her customers with a lot of humor and kindness.

She believes selling school supplies is a profitable enterprise because of the close proximity of her home to a nearby school. Melissa enjoys dealing with children and young people, who always brighten her day with their conversations. However, the most difficult challenge for her is negotiating with suppliers to obtain quality products at fair prices. Her future plans include improving her store by providing new products that will be useful to all students.

Melissa is receiving her fourth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She knows that being responsible is essential for working with the other members of her Communal Bank. With the money she requested, she will buy more school supplies to sell during the last few months of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of school supplies

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
36-year-old Mila T. wants to be successful in her rice farm business. She has eight children. Her eldest child is 15 years old and soon will enroll in college to pursue a degree. She wants to save money for her child’s college educational needs even if it means that she needs to work hard all day. 

She is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm and buy farming needs. The loan will definitely help her achieve a maximum harvest and a better income for her family.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane A. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Maryjane is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Maryjane owns & operates a business in the food sector making & selling food. Her main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Maryjane has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maryjane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maryjane is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her food products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Maryjane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Keo Pech Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan consists of seventeen people and they all live in Peam Ta Aek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Keo P. is the village bank president, as selected by the members. She is a weaver and now she wants to expand her business by purchasing more raw materials to make more mats to sell. Her husband, Mr. Keo Thea, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. Mrs. Keo P. is 53 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other is attending the local school. Mrs. Uon C. and Mrs. Mach N. were not available for the photo so their husbands are shown in the picture.

loans.use: By purchasing more raw materials to make more mats to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sus deseos de superación la motivan a seguir luchando por el bienestar de sus 5 hijos, con quienes vive junto a su esposo.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bocadillos para los eventos sociales que se realizan en su distrito, donde ya es reconocida por su gran habilidad en la repostería, pues no pasan desapercibidos ninguno de los deliciosos pasteles que prepara. Sus hijas son quienes la ayudan con su labor, ya que en ocasiones tiene que preparar cientos de pastillos.
Verónica considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio está en la preparación, pues tiene la capacidad elaborar sus deliciosos bocadillos invirtiendo la mitad de sus ganancias teniendo la posibilidad de seguir aumentando su capital con el fin de cumplir su meta de instalar una fuente de soda, donde venda y exhiba los diversos pasteles y tortas que prepara con tanta dedicación.

Este es su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera seguir trabajando con esmero y puntualidad en sus pagos, al igual que sus compañeras del banco comunal del cual es parte. Con el dinero que ahora solicita adquirirá algunos utensilios necesarios para la preparación de sus dulces bocaditos.
texts.en:
Veronica is 41 years old and a hardworking woman. Her desire to excel motivates her to continue fighting for the welfare of her 5 children, with whom she lives along with her husband.

Veronica prepares and sells snacks for social events in her district. She is recognized for her baking abilities and none of her delicious pastries go unnoticed. Her daughters help her fulfill orders because sometimes she has to prepare hundreds of pastries. Veronica considers her business to be profitable because she is able to invest half of her profits into making her delicious snacks and saving the remainder to increase her capital. Her goal is to open a soda fountain where she can display and sell the various pastries and cakes that she prepares with much dedication.

This is Veronica’s eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She expects to continue working hard and making her payments on time, just like the other members of her Communal Bank. With the money she is requesting, she plans to acquire some utensils used in preparing her sweet snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cooking utensils

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila L. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old. Sheila is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Sheila owns & operates a business in the retail sector operating a specialized "sari sari" retail store. Her main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling shampoo, soap, candies in the local community. Sheila has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Sheila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and business activities. Sheila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to improved and expand the business. Sheila is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Sheila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari sari" retail store

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en:
Pepita A., 51 years old, is a rice farmer. She has six children. Though she is getting older and tilling the farm is becoming more difficult, Pepita is still strong and capable of managing a farm business. She is hoping to get a business loan to strengthen her business. This loan will enable her achieve a maximum harvest of her rice plants. 

Pepita requests a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will be used to buy all the farming necessities and pay for the laborers to help till the farm land.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda M. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Melinda is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Melinda owns and operates a specialized business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling different varieties of products such as rice, sticky rice, eggplant, bitter gourd, etc. in the local community. Melinda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2009, Melinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phalla T. is a group leader of four members who all lives in Popeal Khaer village in Kandal province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more vegetables to resell. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. Mrs. Phalla T. is a 42 year old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Ta C. did not come to take a loan but her husband is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: By purchasing more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
43-year-old Ruben B. owns and manages a small rice field. He has seven children. His eldest child is 30 years old and is married. Ruben wants to improve the family's living conditions, He needs additional capital to finance his business and support the needs of his grandchildren.

He would like to apply for a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to pay the laborers who help till their farm. The loan will also helped buy the farming necessities to ensure a quality and abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita L. is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog Camiguin Province. Lucita is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Lucita owns & operates a business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. Her main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling beauty products such as face powder, cologne, lotion and others in the local community. Lucita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lucita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucita is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lucita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional face powder, cologne, lotion and others products to sell

loans.name: Jantsan

texts.en: Jantsan T. is 36 years old and lives with her 23-year-old daughter in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. T. operates a meat trading business in her town. She sells a variety of meats to her customers from a stall in the local market. T. started her business in 2000 after retiring from her career at a construction company. Her business currently operates at a stable level and she continues to make progress. She hopes to increase her business in the future and her continued success is very important as she must support her daughter, who is disabled. T. is requesting a 485,000 tugrug (~340 USD) loan to purchase more meat in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more meat in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita T., is a former KIVA client. She wants to request another loan to be able to support her small rice field. The income she makes from growing rice is what she uses to buy her family food and other basic needs. It also helps her pay the tuition and other school fees. Her family is totally relying on the size of the harvest that her farm will produce.  Currently, she tills a 1.5-hectare farm. She hopes that someday she will have a larger farm to support more of the family needs. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm and buy farming necessities to increase her harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida M. is from the village of Grace Village, Sto. Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 69 years old. Adelaida is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Adelaida owns & operates a specialized retail business. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling beverages and goods such as  beers, rum, soft drinks and also dry good such as canned goods, chips and others in the local community. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adelaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and business activities. Adelaida is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Adelaida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine V. is now 45 years old and is happily married to Gaudencio V. who is the same age. The sad part in the married life of Josephine and Gaudencio is that they lost their second child. That’s one of the trials in their life that really tested their faith. So the three children became two: Marites, now 25 years old and working as a sales lady, and Joshua, now 16 years old, and currently studying.

The main source of their income is through their variety store business that Josephine has run for ten years now. When she joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she always used the loans that she received in her variety store business to make it grow. And now with her 8th loan she will use the loan again for improving her business. She will buy necessary things for her business to make it more productive.

As a member of ASHI for four years now, Josephine has been a good member. She is always present at center meetings and always on time in paying her responsibilities. That is why Josephine is really sure that she can make their life a better one because of her effort and with the help of ASHI.

One of Josephine’s dreams is that her youngest son finish his studies because she knows that education is one of the keys to success. She really loves her children, so she always wants the best for them every day of their life. She doesn’t want to experience again losing a child; it really broke her heart so much.

loans.use: To finance her variety store business

loans.name: Sakhorn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sakhorn C. is a group leader of five members who all live in Phlov Trei village in Kandal province. She is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Sok Moeun, is a fisherman. This couple has a child who is a fish seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sakhorn C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to support her daughter’s business and she would use the rest of loan to buy more fishnets for fishing.

loans.use: To buy fish and fishnets.

loans.name: Dash

texts.en: Dash A. is a 37-year-old single mother who lives with her 10-year-old son in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her son live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son currently attends a local secondary school. A. operates a meat trading business in her town. She started her business in 2004 after previously working as a nurse for 7 years. A. is a hard worker and has used her good management skills to increase her business over the last 5 years. She is always planning for the future and hopes to start selling fruit in addition to meat next year. She hopes this will attract new customers and increase her earnings. A. is requesting a 400,000 tugrug (~280 USD) loan to purchase more meat to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell in her business

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn M. is from the village of Purok Barangay, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Merlyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing passenger transport (trisikad) services to local community members. Merlyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert M., is a rice farmer and father of a 10 year old child. He has been worrying a lot about their limited family income. His family is truly relying on the income he makes from his farm. He wants to increase the size of his business. Someday, he hopes to purchase more rice farm land. For now, he would like to have an abundant harvest to meet his family's needs.

He has applied for a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy the farming necessities. The loan will truly help him sustain his livelihood and earn a better income for his family.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Mr. Sophoen Morm Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan consists of ten people and they all live in Toek Klang village in Kandal province. Mr. Sophoen M. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. On the farm, he faces an obstacle because his field has a lot of insects which damage the crops. In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides to support his crops and make them more productive. His wife, Mrs. Thung Sina, is a housewife.  Mr. Sophoen M. is 30 years old and the father of two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
38-year-old Susan B. lives in Kapatungan, Trento, Agusan del Sur. Her business is rice farming and she helps her husband till their small rice field to provide their family with adequate food, clothes and other basic needs. She doesn’t mind anymore working all day under the heat of the sun; what she cares about is to be able to raise her children well by doing her best in her business.

Susan would like to ask for a loan of Php 4,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her business and to buy all the farming necessities to ensure that she will have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en:
Myagmar A. is a 36-year-old single mother who lives with her three children in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her three children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest two children attend a local secondary school and her youngest is in kindergarten.

A. operates a small cafe in her town, specializing in a variety of traditional Mongolian meals. Her most popular menu items include huushuur, a fried flour pocket filled with meat; buuz, steamed meat dumplings; and lapsha, a soup with meat and noodles.

A. started her business in 2000 by cooking meals at her home and delivering them to her customers at local businesses and the market. After years of successful operations, her earnings enabled her to open a cafe in a small three-room building. She is now thinking about expanding further and hopes to soon open a small bakery beside her cafe.

A. is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase equipment and supplies to start her bakery and food products for her cafe.

loans.use: To start her bakery and purchase food products for her cafe

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida R., 46, from Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila – a shanty village near a busy harbor. Her husband, Esteban, 41, works for a construction firm. They have three children: two are in high school and the youngest is in grade school.

Zenaida has been selling balut (boiled duck egg with adult embryo, a Filipino delicacy) and pork skin cracklings for six years. She earns close to 12,000 Philippine pesos a month. Her profits have been helpful in meeting their daily needs. She was able to buy home furnishings out of her earnings.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2004. She is due to finish repaying her previous loan with the cooperative so she already applied for a new loan in the amount of P19,000 as fresh capital for her business. She wants to sell balut in other areas of the city. It is also her dream to see her children finish their college education.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social-development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Dashuu

texts.en:
Dashhuu B. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a small house in the Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. Her oldest son and daughter attend a local secondary school and her youngest son is in kindergarten. Her husband is currently employed at a local auto-repair business as a mechanic. 

B. manages a clothes-trading business at the local market in her town. She started her business in 2003 as a partnership with a close friend. She was able to quickly learn much about the management and marketing for a clothing business as her friend and partner already had previous experience in the trade. B. has made much progress with her clothing business and has increased her business capital from 1,500,000 tugrugs ($1,050) when she started to a level exceeding 4,000,000 tugrugs ($2,800) today. Her earnings have enabled her to buy a new house for her and her family, which has much improved their quality of life. 

For the future, B. hopes to use her experience to operate her own clothing store. She wants to sell a wider variety of clothes to meet all of her customers' needs. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to import clothes from China to sell.

loans.use: To import clothes from China to sell

loans.name: Joinelyn

texts.en:
Joinelyn A. is from the village of San Antonio. She is 33 years old. Joinelyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Joinelyn operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Joinelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joinelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joinelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Joinelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her fishing boat. This will be the second loan taken out by Joinelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Mrs. Khem L. lives in Andoung village in Kandal province. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food. She will use the rest of the money to buy fishnets for her husband. Her husband, Mr. Phan Phat, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a fisherman. Mrs. Khem L. is 30 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, pig food, and fishnets.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy M. is from the village of Zone 2, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old. Mercy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products such as viand (tasty dishes) in the local community. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mercy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Mercy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Leab

texts.en: Mr. Leab N. lives in Andoung village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this plantation, he faces a problem because the soil is infertile and he does not have rice seeds to plant in the field. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, and rice seed. He will use the rest of money to buy pig food for his wife, Mrs. Ol Thavy, who is a pig breeder. She is also employed in a garment factory. Mr. Leab N. is 29 years old and the father of two children. One attends the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pig food.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nandivsuren

texts.en:
Nandivsuren B. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Bayanzurkh district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest child currently attends university and her youngest is a high school student.

B. operates a meat-trading business at a small market in the city. She purchases a large amount of meat during the summer and fall and preserves it for sale in the winter when it is in high demand. She started her business in 1998, selling only goat meat, and has become very experienced in her trade.

Today, B.’s business is a very stable operation, and she hopes to expand in the future. Her dream is to one day open a meat-trading center to sell a variety of meat to the people of the city. She continues to support her family with her business and hopes to one day pass it down to her children.

B. is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase goat meat for her business, and to help her oldest daughter purchase her own ger.

loans.use: To purchase goat meat for her business, and to help her oldest daughter purchase her own ger

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
At the age of 61, Cristita A. is still striving hard to fight against their poverty with the help of her husband, Jose A., 63 years old, who works as a carpenter in their place. They are blessed with four sons, namely: Joseph, now 23 years old; Joselito, 22 years old; Jessie, 17 years old; and Mark, 13 years old.

One source of their income comes from her husband’s salary but it’s not enough for their big expenses. So Cristita found an alternative way to add to their daily income. This was the start of her variety store business which has run for six years now.

After she joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc., Cristita’s business began to grow more because she always used the loan that she received to buy what was necessary for her business. Now, her business is doing well and she is very positive that it will continue to grow.

One hope of Cristita is that her business will continue to run for them to enable them to experience a better life and to be able to also help their relatives.

loans.use: To finance her variety store business

loans.name: Purev

texts.en:
Purev D. is 56 years old and lives with her daughter and her daughter's family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in a small house. D. also has a son, age 29, who lives on his own.

D. currently operates two separate businesses in the city. Her primary focus is her vegetable stand, which she operates at one of the largest markets in the city, but she also sells used raw materials such as copper, iron, and glass to supplement her income. Her son also helps support the family with his coal-trading business.

D. started her businesses in 1992 and made quick progress. However, in 1996, her husband passed away and she was left to raise her three children. At that time it was hard for her to continue her work, but she has since worked diligently to grow her businesses to their current successful positions.

D. is always looking for ways to expand her businesses and says, "In the near future I hope to buy a car to begin transporting raw materials and coal directly to my customers." She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to help purchase a car to start transporting raw materials and coal.

loans.use: To help purchase a car to start transporting raw materials and coal

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 41 años muy diligente. Sus deseos de superación la motivan para seguir esforzándose por el bienestar de sus 3 hijas; con quienes vive en compañía de su esposo en su humilde vivienda desde hace 3 años.

Nancy es una mujer de 41 años muy diligente. Sus deseos de superación la motivan para seguir esforzándose por el bienestar de sus 3 hijas; con quienes vive en compañía de su esposo en su humilde vivienda desde hace 3 años.

Este es su noveno préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera seguir trabajando con dedicación y puntualidad en sus pagos, al igual que todas sus compañeras de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá un mejor puesto en el mercado, más cerca al ingreso, de tal modo podrá exhibir sus productos y ofertarlos de una mejor manera, ya que en ese punto hay mayor cantidad de personas.
texts.en:
Nancy is 41 years old and very diligent woman. Her desire to excel motivates her to continue striving for the welfare of her three daughters. She and her husband have been living in their humble home for three years.

She is requesting her ninth loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA. Like the other members of her Communal Bank, Nancy hopes to continue working with the same level of dedication and making her payments on time. The money she is requesting will be used to secure a better vending location at the market that is closer to the entrance where more people congregate. This will enable her to showcase her products and offer them in a better way.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire a new vending location

loans.name: Ochirbat

texts.en:
Ochirbat D. is a 38-year-old single mother who lives in the Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia with her six children. She and her children all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her two youngest daughters currently attend secondary school, and her two young sons, ages 4 and 2, haven't yet started kindergarten. 

D. operates a small sewing business in her town. She repairs and produces a variety of clothing items for her customers at a small rented workspace. Ochirbat started her sewing business in 2003 by herself, but has partnered with her older sister since 2005. Her business is very important for her and her family as it is their only source of income. She has worked hard and found some success, but struggles to support all of her children. 

For the future, Ochirbat hopes to progress her business and says, "I hope to one day own my own workspace." She is requesting a 450,000 tugrug loan to purchase fabrics and materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer que le sonríe a la vida a pesar de las múltiples dificultades que debió afrontar. Ella tiene 31 años y aunque está divorciada vive feliz con sus 2 hijas; Yurubi de 14 y Francesca que tiene 4 años. 

Cada día Carmen se levanta  temprano para atender a sus dos pequeñas hijas que son su adoración y sentido de vida, además debe cocinar rápidamente para los comensales que le compran sus ricos y diversos platos que ofrece cada día. Si hay algún pedido, no hay problema, porque ella misma los entrega hasta donde se lo pidan sus vecinos, conocidos o amigos. Las comidas que vende son muy demandadas, pues a diario innova en las artes culinarias que aprendió de su madre, y los secretos de sus platos no los devela por nada del mundo, así tiene a sus clientes más que satisfechos por el sabor y por los bajos precios que ofrece. 

Desde hace un año, todos los días de la semana, ofrece una delicia diferente para los paladares que la consumen, este negocio le gusta porque ha crecido mucho en poco tiempo y obtiene buenas ganancias, para lograrlo sus hijas también le ayudan en sus ratos libres porque la principal preocupación de Carmen es que sus dos hijas estudien y tengan una profesión, porque ella no lo logró estudiar una. 
Además, su ex esposo la ayuda económicamente en la crianza de sus hijas y para el futuro tiene planeado aperturar  un restaurante donde ella sea la administradora.

Aunque este es su noveno préstamo con MFP,  Carmen promete una vez más ser puntual y cumplir con sus pagos. Ella tiene la esperanza de crecer y lo logrará con mucha dedicación, además está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque está compuesto por mujeres luchadoras como ella. El dinero que ahora solicita lo destinará a la compra de mercadería para abastecerse mejor en la cocina, donde prepara las diversas comidas que comercializa .
texts.en:
Carmen is a woman who smiles at life despite the many difficulties she has had to face. She is 31 years old, divorced, and lives happily with her two daughters – Francesca (age 14) and Yurubi (age 4).

Every day Carmen wakes up early to care for her two young daughters, who provide her with a reason for living and are the objects of her adoration. Afterwards, she must quickly prepare meals for her patrons who purchase the rich and diverse dishes she offers on a daily basis. She fulfills any request without objection, because her customers also ask her to deliver meals to neighbors, acquaintances, or friends. Her dishes are in high demand. Carmen’s ability to create a new dish every day was something she learned from her mother. Even though she keeps her recipes a secret, she manages to satisfy her customers by providing flavorful dishes and selling them at a low price.

Since she offers a different dish every day of the week, her business has grown rapidly and continues to generate good earnings. Her daughters help out in their spare time, but Carmen prefers that they focus on their studies so that they can pursue a profession, an opportunity that she did not have. Her ex-husband provides financial support in raising her daughters. Carmen hopes to manage her own restaurant in the future.

Even though she is taking her ninth loan with MFP, Carmen once again promises to be punctual and make her payments on time. She hopes to continue growing and succeeding. She is happy to be working with her Communal Bank because the other women in her group are fighters just like her. With the money she is requesting, she will buy merchandise to restock her pantry so that she can continue preparing meals to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing meals

loans.name: Zesenjargal

texts.en: Zesenjargal E. and his wife operate a consumer goods trading business out of a shipping container at a local market. They sell a variety of common household goods to their customers. They purchase most of their goods from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, transporting them back to their market to sell. E. is 26 years old and lives with his wife and 4-year-old son in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son is in kindergarten and his wife, Munkhsaikhan, helps out with the family business. E. started his business in 2007 and has quickly established himself in the local business community. He hopes to soon expand his business and increase his earnings. He is requesting a 1,100,000 tugrug loan to purchase more household goods to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more household goods to sell

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
This is Loreta U., a 57-year-old widow living with her five adult children in a poor community in Parola, Binondo, Manila. Loreta has been working with her old sewing machine for more than ten years now, making and marketing infant wear and infant accessories like comforters and fluffy pillows. She makes 45,000 Philippine pesos a month. She has already bought a motorcycle out of her profits.

Loreta is among the pioneer members of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She joined in 1998. Loans provided by the cooperative were very helpful in maintaining her business. She is now applying for a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos as fresh capital for her business. She will buy raw materials like fabric, cotton, thread and other accessories. She has been dreaming of her own house and lot.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice. It is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. CCT serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, cotton, thread and other sewing needs

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
