With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare the meals. She would be grateful for the loan assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa is 35 years old, married and mother of two children. She is a very hard-working woman who works hard to provide for her children. Her children are in school. She is a producer of gari grains. She sells gari grains in bulk in the market. Gari is prepared from milled cassava. She takes delivery of stock from the nearby communities and distributes or vends them during market days. She has a large customer base but her problem has to do with not having adequate funds to buy stock. With the loan assistance, she believes she can be fully resourced to realize her dream of providing education for her children.

loans.use: To buy gari grains.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana D. is  40 years old and married with 2 children She sells shoes and clothes in Oyo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for the past 7 years and involved with LAPO Microfinance for  2 years.  Juliana is soliciting a loan amount of $675 to purchase more shoes and clothes to sell, and to improve her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and clothes

loans.name: Granito De Oro Group

texts.es: Granito de oro es un grupo de 9 mujeres y un varón, todos son   alegres, amables y carismáticos,  actualmente están en el ciclo 2 y se agruparon por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita ampliar sus negocios, una de las integrantes es Merced Lucy M. con 27 años. Es madre de un niño, ella tiene el negocio de venta de ropa de lana de alpaca, inicialmente ella era vendedora pero con la ayuda de su madre logró poner una tienda propia, actualmente necesita el préstamo para la compra de chompa de lana de alpaca, sus principales clientes son los turistas. Las demás integrantes también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de dulces, zapatos ropas, cosméticos y comida y necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería o insumos.
texts.en:
Granito de Oro is a group consisting of nine women and one man, all cheery, amiable and charismatic people. Currently they are in their second loan cycle and they became a group so they could take advantage of capital that would allow them to grow their businesses. One of the members, Lucy M., is 27 years old and mother of one. Her business is selling clothing made out of alpaca wool. Originally she was a salesperson, but with her mother’s help she opened her own store. Currently she needs the loan to purchase alpaca sweaters. Her main customers are tourists. The other members of the group have different businesses, such as selling sweets, shoes, clothing, cosmetics and food, and they need the loan to purchase merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson has been in the motorcycle transportation business for one year now. He is 59 years old, married to Jane Wambui, and has four children who have all finished school and are employed.

Jackson was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. With this loan, Jackson plans to buy a new motorcycle to replace the old one he has been using as a taxi.

Jackson hopes to move into the real estate business in the future.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website:  www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a new motrocycle to use as a taxi

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter has been running his retail store in Njabini, in the outskirts of Naivasha Town, for the last five years. He is 32 years old, married to Gladys Wangari, and has a 9-month-old baby boy. Peter was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 6th loan from the organization. With the loan, Peter plans to buy more retail stock (in bulk which will be cheaper for him) to sell in his shop. Peter hopes to one day open a supermarket in Njabini. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy retail goods in bulk to sell at his shop

loans.name: Mutiyat

texts.en: Mutiyat Y. is 35 years old and lives in Oyo State, Nigeria with her husband and 4 children. She sells sarongs and jewelry and has been in this business for the past 15 years. Mutiyat is requesting a loan amount of $475 to purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma C. is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, is widowed, and has three school-aged children. Gemma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Gemma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en: Estrellita R. is from the village of Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Estrellita owns and operates a business raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Estrellita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Estrellita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional animals. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en:
Mamuna is a 30-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and the mother of three children who are currently in school. She prepares and sells local food like banku, fufu and omotuo with soup and other local dishes. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Omotuo is prepared from rice and it is also taken with any kind of soup. 

She started her local food production 17 years ago and sells in her neighborhood. She is working very hard to provide for the educational needs of her children. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Ayandiji

texts.en: Ayandiji A. is 37 years old, married with 2 children. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria where he sells medicines at retail prices to his customers.He has been in this business for a long time.He hopes that this loan will help him build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for his immediate family. Ayandiji hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is a 40-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and the mother of six children. One child is currently in school while the rest are working. She prepares and sells local food like banku, fufu and omotuo with soup and other local dishes. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Omotuo is prepared from rice and it is also taken with soup. 

She started her local food production 18 years ago and sells in her neighborhood. She is working very hard to provide for the educational needs of the children. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen M. is from the village of Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Helen is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Helen raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Helen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2008, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase medication for her livestock. Helen is requesting a new loan of 9,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ajaratu

texts.en:
Ajaratu is a 52-year-old woman. She is married and is the mother of six children. Three are currently in school and the rest are working.

Ajaratu is a food vendor and serves food like waakye. Waakye is prepared from local rice mixed with beans. Many Ghanaians enjoy it as it has local taste and is a standard. She has been in food production for 35 years now in taking care of the family.

Ajaratu says demand for food is on the higher side but she does not have adequate funds for expansion. She wants to use the loan to buy meat and rice to increase her efficiency by producing in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her children’s educational needs. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for making waakye

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa M. is from the village of Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, is married, and has seven adult children. Rosa owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is married and is a mother with ten children. She is 50 years old and currently living with her family. She is a very hardworking woman and is committed to her work.

Akua prepares and sells doughnuts in her neighborhood. They are prepared from flour and her pastry doughnuts are mostly purchased by the schoolchildren. She sometimes sells the rest through hawking (going door-to-door).

Akua treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She requests the loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine, etc., to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making doughnuts

loans.name: C3752 Group

texts.en:
Boniface N. was born in 1980. He is married and he has no children, but he takes care of one dependent who is 17 years old and is studying in school. Boniface lives in the Kicukiro District of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.  

Boniface runs a general store. He is a successful entrepreneur and his business has been operating for four years. His business is open every day from 7 AM to 6 PM .

He is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company to provide working capital to his growing enterprise. This will allow him to maintain a larger inventory of products for his current customers and, hopefully, to attract new customers as well.  If his expansion strategy is successful, he plans to save the extra money he makes so that he will be able to buy his own house some day.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 35 years old. She is a wife and the mother of three children. Currently one of her children is in school.

Diana enjoys selling goods through her business. This is how she makes a living. She has been selling tubers and yams for ten years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of yams from the farmers. This saves her from intermediaries who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices.

Diana would like to use the loan to buy yams in bulk so she can better meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profits to support her children in school and to expand her business to the desired level.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Las Canelas Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, “Panamericana” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Las Canelas”, con 10 integrantes, se agruparon recientemente para acceder al préstamo, en su mayoría se dedican al tejido artesanal de mantas y otras prendas , es el caso de Martina C. de 39 años, casada y madre de 6 niños, ella teje mantas hace un año, muchos de sus productos lo vende en la feria 16 de Julio ambulando (ofreciendo de puerta a puerta sus productos) y necesita el préstamo para comprar lana. Martina la igual que sus compañeras espera estar mucho tiempo con la familia de Pro Mujer y hacer uso del consultorio, sobre todo para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Asociación Comunal “Las Canelas” is part of “Panamericana”, one of the Focal Centers of Pro Mujer. It is made up for 10 members who mostly work in the weaving of blankets and other artesan items. Martina C. is 39 years old, married and mother of 6 children. She has been weaving blankets for a year now, and she mostly sells her goods in the traveling fair 16 de Julio (selling her goods door to door). She needs the loan to purchase wool. Martina, as well as the other women in the group, expect to be part of the Pro Mujer family for a long time and take advantage of the clinic services, especially for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of wool

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 40 years old. She is married and is a mother with a child who is currently in school.

To support her household, Abena sells cereals like beans and groundnuts (peanuts) to her loyal customers in the community market. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities.

Abena says the selling of these products is very lucrative and, with her six years experience, she can increase her market share. Therefore, she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family, especially her child’s education, and business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Booyaa

texts.en:
Booyaa is fifty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her children and her husband in a rented apartment in the busy commercial town, Ejura. Ejura is in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Booyaa works to support her husband financially and to provide for the family. She is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, beans, and groundnuts. She procures the goods from nearby communities. Booyaa sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for over fifteen years and now wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

She is hopeful that growing her business will allow her to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Jennlyn

texts.en: Jennlyn E. is from the town of Aloran. She is 31 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Jennlyn owns and operates a videoke (also called karaoke - amateur singing to a music video background) bar business, selling soft drinks and other foods in the bar. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximatE. 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jennlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jennlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 30 year old, married woman with three children. Her children are between the ages of 3 and 10 years. All of her children go to school. The family resides and rents a one room house; five people live in the house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. In addition to her children, Harriet also takes care of additional family members. Harriet's monthly expenses include feeding and housing her family and paying for medication.

To earn a living, Harriet runs a ladies salon in Busega Kiribedda. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. Her expenses include transportation costs to and from the salon and shopping for goods. She buys her cosmetics from a shop in Kampala City. On average, Harriet receives 10 customers a day at her salon. She has been in this business five years. Her business challenges include transportation and rainy season, which hinders her customers who travel to come to her.

She has been with MCDT four years and she is servicing her eighth loan, working with the same group of women. Harriet wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of relaxers and cosmetics. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and she would like to start buying directly from manufactures.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream and relaxers

loans.name: Oulimata

texts.fr: Oulimata D. est une femme de 47 ans, elle mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE dans lequel elle a fait de belles performances depuis 7 ans. Elle vend des boubous en basin teinté. Elle s'approvisionne dans la région de Thiès pour ensuite revendre chez elle à Ziguinchor. Elle participe au bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oulimata D. is a 47-year old woman, she is married and she is the mother of 5 children still in her care. She is a member of the Community Bank Yamatogne through which she has had successful experiences for the past 7 years. She sells large flowing gowns called boubous. She purchases her products in the Thies region and later resells them at Ziguinchor. She contributes to the well-being of her family.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To reinforce her business.

loans.name: Zuela

texts.en:
Zuela is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to support her husband financially to provide for the family.

Zuela is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts (peanuts), etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities and sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers.

Zuela has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza is 30 years old. She is married and is a mother with three children. Two of her kids are in school while her last-born is still breastfeeding.

To support her household, Adiza sells cereals like beans, maize and groundnuts (peanuts) to her loyal customers in the community market. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities.

Adiza says the selling of these products is very lucrative and, with her four years experience, she can increase her market share. Therefore, she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family, especially the children’s education, and business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Fummilayo

texts.en: Fummilayo A.  is 39 years old, married with 5 children.  She is a fashion designer and she also sells drinks. She has been in this business for over 15 years and involved with LAPO for the past 2 years. . Fummilayo is asking  for the loan amount of $350 to purchase  a machine, drinks and tailoring materials. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a machine, more drinks and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena has been selling tubers of yam for eight years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of yam from the farmers. This saves her from intermediaries who buy from the farmers and resell at higher price. She enjoys selling goods – her way of making a living.

Abena is 35 years old. She is a wife and the mother of four children. Currently, three are in school. She wants to use this loan to buy yam in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers as Christmas festivities approach. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school and to expand her business to the desired level.

loans.use: To buy yam

loans.name: Aliétou

texts.fr: Aliétou D., 44 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants est membre du Banc Villageois de Boucotte Centre depuis 7 ans et demi. Avec son prêt elle va développer une activité de vente de jus de fruits et de denrées alimentaires tels que le riz et le lait. Les bénéfices générés lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Alietou D. is 44 years old, she is married and she is the mother of 3 children. She has been a member of the Boucotte Centre village bank for the past 7 years. She will invest her loan in the development of her business, selling fruit juices and food staples, such as rice and milk. The revenues generated will allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: A. Emilienne est née le 01 Juin 1959 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Emilienne est mariée à ZINLOZIN Blaise, un transformateur de sodabi (boisson alcoolisée locale) et est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Emilienne vit depuis une vingtaine d’année à Porto-Novo. Emilienne supporte ensemble avec son mari les charges de la famille. Emilienne a arrêté les classes au cours primaire, et depuis une quinzaine d'année, elle vend de l'igname frit et des beignets de haricot à la devanture de sa maison. Emilienne achète ses produits au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Emilienne sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et satisfaire davantage sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Emilienne A. was born on June 1, 1959 in Porto-Novo, the capital city of Benin. Emilienne is married to Blaise Zinlozin, a sodabi brewer (a popular alcoholic drink). She is the mother of four children, all are attending school. Emilienne has lived in Porto-Novo for the past twenty years. Emilienne, together with her husband, supports the family. Emilienne stopped attending school in the primary grades, and for the past fifteen years she has been selling fried sweet potatoes and bean donuts in front of her home. Emilienne purchases her products in the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. She is long-time member of Alide (Kiva Field Partner) and she has already benefited from two past loans, which have been repaid. Emilienne requests a third loan from Alide to increase her capital funds and to meet the clients’ demands.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of beans and sweet potatoes, drums of cooking oil and a load of wood.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 35-year-old married woman with five children aged between 7 and 18 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a one-roomed house where she lives with five people. Joyce also takes care of additional family members. The family doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water.

Joyce has a stall selling vegetables and bananas and pays for transport costs to and from shopping. On average, she receives about thirty customers a day. She works in the outskirts of Kampala and has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT seven years. She is servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group members.

Joyce’s monthly expenses include feeding the family, accommodation, and medication. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season which hinders her customers from coming to her.

Joyce wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of tomatoes, cabbages and sacks of bananas. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start buying directly from farmers.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, cabages, and sacks of bananas

loans.name: Oyinade

texts.en:
Oyinade O. is a 42-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

For over eight years now, she has earned a living by selling wood. She has been with LAPO for the past two years. Oyinade is now requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 ($675) to purchase more wood for resale purposes. She expresses her deep gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is 29 years old. She is divorced and is the mother of four children, all of whom are currently in school.

Ama enjoys selling goods, the business from which she makes a living. She has been selling tubers of yam for six years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of yams from the farmers. This saves her from intermediaries who buy from the farmers and resell to her at a higher price.

Ama wants to use the loan to buy yams in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers as we approach the Christmas festivities. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school and to expand business to the desired level. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Rabi

texts.en:
Rabi is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to one girl who is in school. She lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to support her husband financially to provide for the family.

Rabi is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge on a table by the roadside in the mornings. She procures the ingredients from nearby communities and has been in business for over ten years.

Rabi wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful to give her child the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Sona

texts.fr: Sona B. est une femme de 57 ans, elle est veuve et vit avec son petit fils. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE CENTRE depuis 3 ans et demi où elle a eu 7 expériences avec le crédit. Avec son crédit elle développe une activité de vente de légumes et de poissons secs. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins et de s'occuper de son petit fils
texts.en:
Sona B. is a 57-year old woman, she is a widoww and she lives with her young son. She has been a member of the Boucotte Centre village bank for the past 3 and a half years and she has had 7 past loans. With the loan she develops her business selling vegetables and dried fish. Her revenues permit her to provide for her own needs and to take care of her little boy.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Ghislaine Francisca

texts.fr: La cliente est née vers 1977 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. Elle assure avec son conjoint les charges de la famille. Elle est allée à l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Il y a quatre ans que la cliente s'est mise à vendre des tissus, des produits de beauté et aussi des glacières, des plastiques et des bassines. C'est à Lomé au Togo, État voisin du Bénin, et à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, qu'elle s'approvisionne. Elle avait bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. C'est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et agrandir davantage son activité qu'elle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The client was born around 1977 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married and has two children, one of whom attends school. She and her husband both work to support the family financially. She was a student until high school. Four years ago, the client began selling fabric, beauty products, ice chests, and plastic basins. She purchases goods for resale in Lomé, Togo (a neighboring country) and in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She has previously had two loans from ALIDé, which she successfully repaid. She will use this third loan to increase her working capital and expand her business.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and beauty products

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es: La señora Micaela T. T. guatemalteca que se identifica con cedula de vecindad H-8 y de registro numero 38,284 originaria de Totonicapan es una persona viuda  y de 56 años de edad que se dedica a la crianza de animales especialmente los pollos que le otorgo el credito porque demuestra ser una persona responsable y honesta capaz de pagar dicho prestamo que le resvira para ampliar su capital y tener como llevar un pedazo de pan a su fam,ilia, por medio tambien del credito ella quiera ser una mujer emprendedora.
texts.en:
Mrs. Micaela T. T. is a Guatemalan from Totonicapan with H-8 residency card number 38,284. She is a 56 year old widow who raises animals, especially chickens. She merits the loan because she has demonstrated that she is a responsible and honest person, capable of repaying the loan.

Micaela needs the credit to expand her capital and provide bread for her family. By means of this loan, she also wishes to become an enterprising woman.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO FINANCE HER POULTRY BUSINESS

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 30 years old and has two kids who are currently in school.

Victoria trades in yams in the local market of Atebubu, a town in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Her major difficulty has to do with funds to support the business. She requests the loan to enable her to buy tubers of yam in bulk to grow her business and scale up sales.

Victoria hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education to give them better future career opportunities. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam in bulk

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 45 años, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa en sus labores, además es madre de 4 hijos jóvenes.

Sus deseos de progresar y de buscar la forma de ganar dinero la motivaron a formar parte de un grupo de consultoras de belleza. Es así que desde hace 5 años viene trabajando en la venta de cosméticos, lo cual disfruta mucho pues recorre diversos lugares de su ciudad, aunque lo difícil y cansado sean los viajes debido a las largas horas de trayecto. 
Ella considera que la rentabilidad de su actividad está en la compra de productos al por mayor, pues los adquiere a precios bajos con la facilidad de pagarlos en cuotas pequeñas, lo que le da la posibilidad de vender mayor cantidad de productos de manera rápida, sin tener que esperar la llegada de los pedidos por el catálogo.
Sus planes a futuro son de seguir una línea de carrera dentro de la venta de cosméticos, así como trabajar con diversas muchachas que agilicen su trabajo distribuyéndolas en diversos lugares de la ciudad. 

Este es su noveno préstamo (individual) con Microfinanzas PRISMA, desde que comenzaron sus créditos siempre se mostró cumplida con sus pagos, al igual que sus compañeras de grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita aprovechará las ofertas de los catálogos para incrementar su stock de productos y venderlos en la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Sonia is 45 years old. She is hard-working and determined, and is also the mother of 4 young children. Her desire to get ahead and make money motivated her to join a group of beauty consultants. For 5 years, she has worked selling cosmetics. She enjoys this work as it takes her to various parts of the city, although the long hours of travel make it difficult.

Sonia believes the best profit in her business comes from buying wholesale at low prices, with the option of repaying in small payments. This gives her possibility of selling a quantity of products rapidly without having to wait for them to arrive from a catalog order. Her future plans are to continue this career path, working with other women in the group. This will increase sales by distributing products in many parts of the city.

This is Sonia’s ninth individual loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Since she began she has demonstrated that she is prompt in her payments, as are the other group members. With this loan, Sonia will take advantage of sales in the catalogs, building up her inventory in preparation for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is a 35-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

For the past 15 years, she has been in the business of selling wood, and she notes that she has been a member of LAPO for the past two years. Rebecca is now requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 ($675) to purchase more wood so as to meet the high demand of her customers. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: To satisfy customer demand by purchasing additional wood

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 40 years old. She is married and is a mother with seven children, six of whom are currently in school. She is very humble and committed to her work and to the family needs because she believes the children are her asset.

Amina has sold smoked fish in bulk at the community market where she lives for fifteen years now. She buys her stock of goods from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and sometimes spends more time there so that she can buy good quality dried and smoked fish. This, she said, removes the need for frequent traveling.

Amina requests the loan to buy an increased stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of smoked fish

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 30 años, trabaja muy duramente, pues sus deseos son de velar por el bienestar  de su hogar. Ella sola trata de cubrir los gastos de sus 2 hijos, con quienes vive en su pequeña casa que apenas está en construcción.

La habilidad que tiene en las máquinas de coser le abrió las puertas para trabajar en diversos talleres textiles de su distrito y ahora viene trabajando en sociedad con su hermana, y ambas trabajan reciben pedidos de las fábricas del centro de la ciudad.
Ella considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio se encuentra en la fabricación de diseños nuevos para después ofrecerlos a los fabricantes, pues reciben ingresos adicionales por los diseños y la elaboración. En estos 5 años de labor ha podido disfrutar diseñando diversas prendas, sin embargo lo difícil de su trabajo es hacer los acabados, pues son cientos de prendas y esto le afecta la vista.
Para el futuro, Silvia planeado instalar un taller con maquinaria nueva que agilicen su trabajo en casa.

Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, por lo que se compromete a trabajar arduamente para no defraudar la confianza que depositaron en ella y en su trabajo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprara los materiales de costura necesarios para seguir trabajando y entregando sus pedidos con prontitud.
texts.en:
Silvia is 30 years old and works very hard, striving to ensure the well-being of her household. She alone tries to cover the expenses of her two children; she lives with them in a small house which is still under construction. Her talent with sewing machines opened the doors for her to work in various textile workshops of her district. Now she is working in partnership with her sister; both of them receive and fill orders from factories in the city center. Silvia believes that the profitability of her business depends on producing new designs to offer to the manufacturers, since she and her sister receive additional income for their designs and creations. During the past 5 years in her business, she has enjoyed the process of designing a range of clothing items. However, the most difficult part of her job is the finishing work, since there are hundreds of garments and the work affects her eyesight. For the future, Silvia plans to install a workshop with new machines which will make her work at home easier. This is Silvia's first loan with PRISMA Microfinances, and she has made a commitment to work hard and not to abuse the confidence that has been placed in her and her work. With the funds she is requesting, she will purchase the necessary sewing supplies so that she can continue working and delivering her orders promptly.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing textile supplies

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es un joven soltero de 20 años, vive junto a sus padres y a sus 2 hermanos, en la vivienda que sus padres lograron comprar hace 10 años.

Él es un chico muy hábil e inteligente; por ello hace 2 años, con el apoyo de sus padres decidió implementar un locutorio público (centro de llamadas) en un ambiente de su casa. 
Este negocio que le ha permitido estudiar una carrera profesional que terminará en 2 años y con él, también trabajan sus 2 hermanos menores, por lo que toda la familia está muy contenta porque tiene muchos clientes y están seguros que con mucha dedicación obtendrán mejores ganancias.

Este es su noveno crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está sabe que con responsabilidad y compromiso en sus pagos garantizará su trabajo. Con el dinero que solicita ampliará su negocio con la apertura de nuevas cabinas, de tal modo podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a young man who is 20 years old. He lives with his parents and two siblings in the family home that his parents bought 10 years ago.

He is a capable and intelligent individual. Two years ago, with the support of his parents, Ricardo decided to establish a call center in a room within his home. This business enables him to study for a professional career and he is scheduled to complete his training within two years. His two younger brothers also help with the business. In fact, the entire family is very pleased because they have many customers and are confident that they will continue generating good earnings as long as they remain dedicated to the business.

Ricardo is taking his ninth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. He is known for being committed and responsible with his payments. With the money he requested, Ricardo will expand his business by installing new phone booths so that he can provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install new phone booths

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar es una muchacha soltera de 24 años, trabaja junto a su padre para contribuir con los gastos de su familia (su madre y sus dos hermanos), con quienes viven en una casa alquilada desde hace 5 años. 

Ella ayuda a su padre a realizar instalaciones eléctricas a domicilio, actividad que realiza por las tardes después de salir del instituto donde estudia electricidad. A ella siempre le gustó la electrónica y la electricidad, por ello considera que ayudar a su padre es algo provechoso para su carrera, además contribuye con su familia económicamente.
Sin embargo, a veces no pueden realizar más trabajos porque no poseen todos los instrumentos y equipos necesarios, pues sabe que con el talento y las ganas que tienen podrían realizar mayores labores.

Este es su noveno crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está segura que con responsabilidad y compromiso en sus pagos garantizará su trabajo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará algunos instrumentos, equipos y herramientas necesarias para poder realizar otros y mayores trabajos.
texts.en:
Pilar is a single woman who is 24 years old. She works alongside her father in contributing toward the expenses of her family (which also includes her mother and two siblings). They have been living in a rented house for the past 5 years.

She assists her father with home electrical installations, an activity she pursues in the afternoons after she attends classes at an institute where she is studying to become an electrician. Carmen has always enjoyed electronics and the technical aspects of being an electrician, so she thought this would be a good way to help her father and also earn a living. This way, Carmen will be able to contribute to the family financially. However, she is not able to take on additional work because she does not have all the necessary tools and equipment. Carmen knows she has the talent and desire to accept more jobs.

She is taking her ninth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Carmen is confident in her commitment and responsibility to make her payments on time. With the money she requested, she will buy the instruments, equipment, and tools necessary for her to take on more jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools & equipment

loans.name: Telma Veronica

texts.es: Doña Telma Veronica T. A. es una persona responsable que se dedica a la venta de ropa para bebes y que siempre mira mas alla, es una mujer con muchos sueños y uno de ellos es contar con un negocio mas grande y vender ropa surtida para grandes y pequeños y de esa manera apoya a su familia especialmente a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos.es originaria del paraje chuipachec final de la zona 1, Totonicapan, Guatemala quien se identifica con su cedyla de vecindad H-8 y de registro numero 91,102 de 24 años de edad. casada.
texts.en:
Doña Telma Veronica T. A. is a responsible person who sells baby clothes. She is someone who always looks ahead. One of her many dreams is to have a bigger business in which she sells an assortment of clothing in all sizes so that she can help with the family expenses. Telma is originally from the village of Chuipachec in District #1 of Totonicapan, Guatemala. She is 24 years old and married.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her capital to acquire more clothing

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es una mujer divorciada de 37 años, actualmente vive con sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Desde niña se dedicó al comercio junto a su madre, y desde hace 5 años ella cuenta con un puesto afuera del mercado de su localidad donde vende tubérculos desde muy temprano por l mañana. Patricia debe alternar su trabajo con las labores domésticas, ya que trabaja sola para mantener a sus hijos. Ella es una persona muy carismática, por ello sus clientes siempre vienen a buscarla, sin embargo considera que si tuviera un puesto en el interior del mercado podría generar mayores ingresos para su hogar.

Este es su noveno crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está segura que con responsabilidad y compromiso en sus pagos garantizará su trabajo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita tendrá la posibilidad de dar un adelanto de pago para obtener un nuevo puesto en el interior del mercado, con el que podrá obtener mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Patricia is 37 years old, divorced, and currently living with her 2 children in a rented house. Since childhood she has worked retail together with her mother, and for 5 years she has had a stand outside of her town's market, where she sells tubers in the early morning. Patricia must alternate her job with her domestic chores, since she works only to support her children. She is a very charismatic person, for which her clients always come to look for her. However, she believes if she had a stand inside the market, she would be able to generate a better income for her home. This is her ninth credit with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is sure that with responsibility and commitment in her payments, her job will be guaranteed. With the money that she is requesting now, she will have the possibility of giving a deposit in order to obtain a new stand inside the market, with which she will be able to obtain a larger number of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Deposit for a stand in the market

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. is a 38-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria.

For several years now, she has been in the business of selling women's clothes and sarongs in her shop. She explains that she has been with LAPO for over two years. Alice is seeking a loan in the amount of N50,000 ($350) to purchase additional sarongs for resale purposes. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: To purchase additional sarongs

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati is 28 years old. She is married and is a mother with three children. Currently all of her children are schooling. They are a very humble family who want to invest in their children’s future by providing them with a quality education.

Fati is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tinned tomatoes, bags of rice, etc. In selling these products, she says, they move very fast and you can easily recover your money. She takes delivery of goods from the surrounding communities where she lives.

With her three years experience in her business Fati wants to add other goods like cereals to increase her product line to retain her customers. She believes that this can be possible with the help of loan assistance. Therefore she wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tinned tomatoes, etc.

Fati is much convinced that the loan would help her increase her stock in the event of a price hike. She also believes this would help her save more towards her kid’s education.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 35 años, es madre soltera y trabaja arduamente para satisfacer las necesidades de sus pequeños hijos, quienes siempre le brindan momentos agradables en su hogar.

Sus estudios de contabilidad le ayudaron a conseguir un empleo para una empresa, pero su remuneración no alcanzaba para solventar sus gastos. Por tal motivo, adicionalmente, decidió comenzar a vender ropa y son sus compañeras de trabajo sus principales clientes.
Esta actividad la viene realizando desde 4 años, tiempo en que también viene disfrutando de la amistad de sus clientas. Pero lo difícil del negocio es realizar las compras en el centro de la ciudad, pues la delincuencia amenaza con hacerle pasar un mal momento, por lo que siempre trata de ser prudente en las zonas peligrosas. 
Para el futuro, Martha desea instalar un stand y vender ropa de primera calidad, así como diseñar sus propias prendas, las cuales tengan la  oportunidad de ser aceptadas en el mercado tan competitivo.

Este es su noveno préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y sabe que su responsabilidad y puntualidad dentro de su banco comunal es indispensable, para seguir desarrollándose como una comerciante exitosa. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más prendas acorde a la última temporada y aprovechará algunas ofertas en los supermercados.
texts.en:
Martha is 35 years old, a single mother, and she works arduously in order to satisfy the needs of her small children, who always provide her with enjoyable moments in her home. Her studies in accounting helped her get a job for a company, but her salary wasn't enough to cover her expenses. For that reason, additionally she decided to begin selling clothing, and her coworkers are her main clients. She has been doing this activity for 4 years, in which time she has also enjoyed the friendship of her clients. However, the difficult part of the business is making purchases in the center of the city, because delinquency threatens to give her a hard time. Therefore, she always tries to be wise in the dangerous zonas. For the future, Martha desires to set up a stand and sell high quality clothing, as well as design her own garments, which will have the opportunity to be accepted in such a competitive market. This is her ninth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she knows that her responsibility and punctuality within her communal bank are indispensible, in order to continue growing as a successful merchant. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase more garments according to the latest season and will take advantage of the sales in the supermarkets.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 32 años muy trabajadora y diligente, está casada desde hace 10 años y tiene 2 hijos y una hija. Junto a su familia, vive en una casa alquilada en un distrito al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de verduras en un puesto del mercado de su localidad, esta actividad la realiza para poder contribuir con los aportes económicos en casa. A ella le gusta el comercio de verduras porque aprendió desde niña con su madre.
Asimismo, María considera que su negocio es rentable porque siempre hay una gran cantidad de clientes en el mercado en busca de estos productos. 
Su meta a futuro es poder tener una mayor cantidad de mercadería para superar a la competencia que hay en el mercado, de tal modo que sus ingresos puedan mejorar.

Este es su noveno préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera seguir trabajando con dedicación y responsabilidad en sus pagos porque es una manera muy buena de progresar. Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá mayor cantidad de verduras para poder ofrecerlas en su puesto a un precio más bajo, para ganar más clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old and a very hard-working and diligent woman. She has been married for 10 years and has 2 sons and 1 daughter. Together with her family, she lives in a rented house in a southern district of the city of Lima. For 8 years she has made a living by selling vegetables at a stand in her town's market, which she does in order to contribute to paying the economic expenses at home. She likes selling vegetables because she learned with her mother as a young girl. Also, Maria considers her business to be worthwhile because there is always a large number of clients in the market looking for these products. Her future goal is to be able to have a greater quantity of merchandise to surpass the competition in the market, thereby improving her income. This is her ninth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she hopes to continue working with dedication and responsibility on her payments, because it is a very good way to progress. With the money that she is requesting, she will acquire a greater quantity of vegetables in order to offer them at her stand at a lower price and gain more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una diligente ama de casa, casada con un responsable padre de familia. Ellos tienen 2 hijos y viven en una casa alquilada, desde hace 15 años, en un distrito al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Hace 5 años, junto a su esposo, decidieron implementar una pequeña bodega, para ello alquilaron otro ambiente de la casa donde residen. Ella se hizo cargo de este negocio, con el cual ha podido pagar los estudios de su hijo mayor en la universidad, lo que la llena de motivación para seguir trabajando. Sin embargo a veces no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder hacer crecer aun más su negocio, pues los gastos en casa se han incrementado a medida que sus hijos van creciendo.
María considera que puede progresar con el apoyo de sus hijos, y mediante un préstamo incrementar sus productos para la campaña navideña, ya que su bodega es muy conocida en su localidad por su gentileza con los clientes.

Este es su noveno crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está segura que la responsabilidad y compromiso en sus pagos garantizarán su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria is a diligent housewife, married to a responsible family man. They have 2 children and have lived in a rented house for 15 years, in a southern district of the city of Lima. Five years ago, together with her husband, they decided to set up a small grocery store, for which they rented another part of the house where they reside. She put herself in charge of this business, with which she has been able to pay for the studies of her older son in college, which fills her with motivation to keep working. However, sometimes she does not have the necessary capital to be able to make her business grow even more, because the expenses at home have increased while her children have grown up. Maria believes she can make progress with the support of her children, and through this loan increase her products for the Christmas season, since her grocery store is very well known in her town for its kindness with the clients. This is her ninth credit with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is sure that responsibility and commitment in her payments will warrant her work.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: A. Antoinette est née en 1980 à Sahouè au Sud du Bénin. Mariée à AYETCHE Paulin, un transitaire, Antoinette est mère de deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants à Gbodjè à Porto-Novo, ça fait six mois de cela. Antoinette a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Afin d'aider son mari Paulin dans les charges de la famille, Antoinette vend depuis cinq ans déjà, des sacs de maïs et de riz à son domicile. Antoinette mène également comme activité secondaire, la vente de tissus par le système de distribution. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Antoinette s'approvisionne. Antoinette a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Antoinette sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et accroître la taille de son activité.
texts.en:
Antoinette A. was born in 1980 in Sahouè in the south of Bénin. She is married to Paulin AYETCHE, a clearing agent. Antoinette is the mother of two children, one is attending school. For the last six months, the couple has been living with their children in Gbodjè in Porto-Novo. Antoinette stopped her education in elementary school. For 5 years already, she has been helping her husband with the family' s expenses. She has been selling bags of corn and rice from her home. Antoinette also has a secondary activity where she sells fabric through the distribution system.

Antoinette stocks up in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Antoinette has already received two loans from ALIDé, those have been fully reimbursed. Antoinette is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to increase her working capital and increase the size of her business.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn and rice, and bolts of fabric.

loans.name: Ashietu

texts.en:
Ashietu is 35 years old. She is married and is the mother of six children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to support her husband in taking care of the family.

Ashietu is a food vendor. She prepares and serves ‘tuozafi’. Tuozafi is prepared from cassava flour and is taken with special soup. Many Ghanaians enjoy it because of its taste and its rich local flavor.

Ashietu requests the loan to buy raw materials like meat, vegetables, firewood, etc., to serve the demands of her customers. She saves part of her profits for her kids’ future. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making tuozafi

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 42 años, está casada desde hace 20 años y su motivación para salir adelante son sus 3 hijos, quienes viven junto a ella y esposo en la casa que compraron hace 5 años y aun no terminan de pagar.

Por ello, desde que amanece Leonor abre su tienda, en la cual vende abarrotes, útiles de escritorio y artículos en general. Su negocio se encuentra en su vivienda y lo logró implementar a base de mucho esfuerzo hace 2 años, gracias a los ahorros que poseía junto a su esposo. 
Ella cuenta con el apoyo de dos de sus hijos, quienes atienden la tienda cuando vuelven del colegio y a Leonor le gusta mucho poder contribuir con el desarrollo de sus hijos con el dinero que gana. 
Además, cree que con algo de dinero podría impulsar su negocio, ya que tiene muchos clientes, los cuales ha ganado con su amabilidad y buen trato, para ello desea comprar una mayor variedad de productos para surtir mejor su tienda y así poder captar una mayor cantidad de clientes.

Este es su noveno crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está segura que con responsabilidad y compromiso en sus pagos garantizará su trabajo.
texts.en:
Leonor is 42 years old, has been married for 20 years, and her motivation for getting ahead are her 3 children, who live with her and her husband in the house that they bought 5 years ago and have not yet paid off. For this reason, in the morning Leonor opens her store, in which she sells groceries, office supplies, and other items. Her business is located in her home, and she managed to set it up 2 years ago through a lot of effort, thanks to the savings that she and her husband possessed. She counts on the support of two of her children, who attend to the store when they return from school, and Leonor really likes to be able to contribute to the development of her children with the money she earns. Furthermore, she believes that with some money she could give a boost to her business, since she has a lot of clients, whom she has gained through her friendliness and good treatment. She wishes to purchase a greater variety of products to better stock her store and therefore be able to attract a greater number of clients. This is her ninth credit with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she is sure that with responsibility and commitment in her payments, she will justify her work.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica es una madre soltera de 26 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes le brindaron lo necesario para que pueda seguir adelante en sus planes de negocio, por lo cual está muy agradecida y trata de apoyarles con los gastos de la casa.

Desde que tuvo la oportunidad de ingresar a trabajar para una línea de belleza no dudó en hacerlo, pues siempre quiso trabajar de manera independiente y este negocio le permite no descuidar a su pequeño hijo. Es así que desde hace unos años está trabajando vendiendo productos de belleza por los alrededores de su distrito, pues es ahí por donde tiene amistades quienes se han convertido en sus clientes y diariamente solicitan sus productos.
Lo que más le agrada de su actividad son los lazos de amistad que mantiene y nuevos que entabla, pues está constantemente visitando a sus clientes.
Jessica considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio está en aprovechar las ofertas de los productos que hay en los catálogos, pues según estas ventas recibe premios adicionales que le ayuda a mejorar su stock.
Sus planes a futuro son de instalar un stand en su localidad, pues siempre anheló tener una tienda que pueda administrar.

Este es su noveno préstamo (individual) con Microfinanzas PRISMA y desde que inició su trabajo con la institución siempre fue responsable y comprometida, tanto de manera individual, como con su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará grandes cantidades de productos de belleza para venderlos en la próxima campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 26-year old single mother who lives with her parents. They provided her with assistance so that she could move ahead in her business plans, for which she is very grateful, and in return she tries to help them with the household expenses. When she had the opportunity to get into a line of work selling beauty products she did not hesitate to do so, as she always wanted to work independently in a way that would allow her not to neglect her infant son. Thus, she has for some years been working selling beauty products around her district, and has had friends who she turned into customers who solicit her business daily. What she likes best about this activity are the bonds of friendship that she maintains and the new ones she strikes up as she is constantly visiting her customers. Jessica believes that the profitability of her business rests on taking advantage of the product offers that are in the catalogs, because when she makes these sales she receives additional awards of product to increase her inventory. In the future she plans to have a stand in her locality, for she has always longed to have a store that she can manage. This is her ninth loan (individual) with Microfinanzas PRISMA and since she started to work with the institution she has always been responsible and committed, both individually as well as with her communal bank. With the money that she is requesting she will buy large quantities of beauty products to sell in the next Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 32 years old and married with four children. All her children are currently in school. She is very humble and committed to her work and her family's needs because she believes the children are her greatest asset.

She sells smoked fish in bulk at the market in the community where she lives. She has five years of selling experience. Fatima purchases her stock of goods from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and sells it at retail prices to her customers. She sometimes spends more time when she buys her stock so that she can buy good quality dried and smoked fish. This keeps her from having to travel frequently. She requests this loan to buy more stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a supply of smoked fish in bulk.

loans.name: Sara Mariela

texts.es: Sara Mariela S. M. es una señorita de 28 años de edad, quien actualmente labora en el Banco Reformador como cajera y ella utiliza el credito para gastos personales como por ejemplo de remodelacion de su vivienda donde actualmente vive, en ella se puede ver una persona responsable, para realizar sus pagos ya que por medio de este creditos apoyamos las necesidad de los jovenes asi como la de Sara que son jovenes con muchos sueños y que tambien desde sus edad ya ven cuales son las necesidades que se nosa atraviezan en el camino.apesar de que ella es joven por medio de este credito ayuda a sus padres a mejoras sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sara Mariela S. M. is a 28 year old Guatemalan woman who works as a teller at Banco Reformador. She is asking for a $275 loan in order to remodel her house and help her parents. She is a responsible woman who pays her bills on time. Young adults like Ms. M. face difficulties in their way to accomplish their dreams, but we are here to help them get there and improve their lives. Help Sara today!

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal Use: improve life conditions

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Our client is Andrea.  She is part of a communal bank consisting fifteen neighbors who live in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco.  The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. She is from Ccorao. She is 47 years old and lives with her partner and her four children (2 boys and 2 girls) who are all studying in secondary school.

Andrea is new to the group but has received other loans in the past from Arariwa.  She has an artisan craft store where she sells hand-made bronze work, carpets and teas at the Ccorao lookout point.  She buys goods from wholesalers in Cusco.  She sells approximately one hand-made item a week, but sometimes she doesn’t sell anything at all.  Andrea will use this loan to buy more merchandise for her artisan craft store.

Andrea appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her artisan craft store

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is 28 years old and married with three children. She is very supportive of her husband in taking care of the family. She trades in flip-flops and sells through hawking in the community where she lives and its surroundings. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She requests the loan to buy stocks of flip-flops to increase her profits, as there is high demand for her stock. She would be the happiest person to receive your assistance.

loans.use: To buy flip-flops in bulk.

loans.name: Apuma

texts.en:
Apuma is 45 years old and the mother of seven children. All her children are in school from primary to junior high level. To support her household, she has been selling cereals like beans, maize, millet, rice and groundnuts to her loyal customers in the community market. She says the selling of these products is very lucrative because cereals are fast-moving goods.

Apuma has been in business for the last three years with lots of selling experience. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities in the northern part of Ghana and some in the Burkina Faso. She requests this loan to increase her stock as we approach the Christmas festivities. She believes it would enable her make a good income to support her family, especially in their education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnut, rice, maize, millet and beans.

loans.name: Sarda

texts.en: Sarda is 50 years old and married with four children. Currently all of her kids are in school. She owns and operates a grocery store and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits and so on in the local market. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices and washing soaps and powders to expand her business. She hopes to make a good income from the expanded business to enable her to provide the children with quality education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy supplies in bulk

loans.name: Carlota Eugenia

texts.es: Carlota Eugeniqa F. R. es una persona de 40 años quien se identifica con su cedula de vecindad H-8 y de registro numero 59,755 con su domicilio en la colonia Molino Viejo Tierra Blanca Totonicapan, casada, quien labora para el banco reformador ocupando el puesto de Jefe de agencia, la misma requiere un credito para mejorar sus condiciones de vida en os que es mejorar algunos cuartos de sus vivienda y darles mejor comodidad a sus hijos creemos que es beneficio para toda la familia y es una forma de como colaborar con su esposo para la mejora de sus hogar y creemos que cubre el credito.
texts.en:
Carlota Eugeniqa F. Rodríguez, 40, has an H-8 residency card number 59,755. Her home is in the Molino Viejo Tierra Blanca district in the Totonicapan department. She is married. Her husband works as manager of an agency for the Banco Reformador in the Totonicapan department. She needs a loan to improve her living conditions. She will improve some rooms in her house to make her children more comfortable, which is beneficial for the whole family. It is a way of collaborating with her husband to improve their home. We believe the loan will cover it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her home

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is 39 years old and married with three children. He sells and repairs electronics of different kinds. He lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. He has been in this business for the past twelve years, and has been with LAPO for over two years. Joshua is soliciting a loan amount of N150, 000 to improve his business. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 27 years old and single. She has two children, a boy and a girl, and they attend school. As a single mother she works very hard to provide for her children, especially for their education and their shelter, as well as paying the bills.

Martha is a food vendor. She prepares and sells maize porridge in the community where she lives. Her porridge is enjoyed by many people for breakfast. She prepares and sells it very hot through hawking. She has been in business for three years, taking care of her family.

She requests the loan to buy bags of maize, sugar, bread, cartons of milk and so on to prevent a price hike.

loans.use: To buy maize, sugar, firewood etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Our client is Margarita.  She is part of a communal bank consisting of fifteen neighbors in Ccorao, a town thirty minutes from Cusco.  The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. She is from Yerna but lives in Cusco. She is 30 years old and is married with a 2 ½ year-old son.

This is her second loan from Arariwa.  She prepares refreshments for students in first and second grade. She sells approximately 100 plates per day for 2 soles each. She earns about 50 soles a day, which is the equivalent of $17.50.  She will use this loan to buy ingredients for her student meals.

Margarita appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients (oil, arroz, etc) for her student meals

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married and has one child. She owns a small store where she sells various cosmetics products. She has been in this business for twelve years. This experience helps her to choose the right products and to make good sales. Oksana has special prices for certain types of clients, for example older people, and this helps them manage their lives better.

Oksana's business goal is to develop her business further and increase her sales. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. Oksana would use the additional income to remodel her apartment and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is 43 years old and married with seven children who are currently in school. Yaa is a very resourceful mother. She works with the motivation of supporting her children’s education, which will provide them with better life opportunities in the future.

Yaa sells a variety of soft drinks together with meat pies, which provides her customers with lunch in the afternoon. She sells through ‘hawking’. Her customers are usually passengers at bus stops.

With the loan, Yaa wants to take delivery of more soft drinks and also to make her meat pies in bulk. This would enable her to take advantage of the market. She hopes to use part of her profit to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and make meat pies in bulk.

loans.name: Juana Micaela

texts.es: Doña Juana Micaela C. T. es originaria del paraje Chocolet, Canton Chiyax Totonicapan y ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, ese trabajo los ha venido realizando desde varios años y por medio del mismo a logrado sobre salir con sus hijos porque le genera un ingreso para darles de que comer a sus hijos, ella se ha dado cuenta que gana bien,por tal razon necesita un credito para poder ampliar su capital y asi comprar mas animales siempre lo realiza con la ayuda de sus pequeños, creemos que es factible darle el credito porque es una persona que admira a los demas y no se quere quedar con lo poco que tiene si no quiere crecer hasta ser una persona de mayor exito y demostrarle a las demas que sioendo mujer si pueder trabajar sin tener estudio.
texts.en:
Doña Juana Micaela C. T. is from Chocolet, Canton Chiyax Totonicapan, and she raises pigs. She has been doing this work for a number of years and through it she and children have managed to make a successful living because she earns enough of an income to be able to feed her children. Juana realizes that she earns a decent salary, and for that reason she is requesting a loan to increase her capital and buy more animals. She is always able to do her job with the help of her little ones. We believe that it should be possible to grant her a loan as she is a person who respects others, and she does not want to remain with the little that she has; rather she would like to grow to become a very successful person and show others that women without a formal education are still able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital Growth

loans.name: Hermine Vicentia Adjou

texts.fr: H. Hermine Vicentia Adjou est née le 30 Novembre 1972 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à GBAGUIDI Natal, un commerçant, Hermine Vicentia Adjou est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Hermine Vicentia Adjou vit depuis quatre ans à Cocotomey non loin de Cotonou. Hermine Vicentia Adjou supporte les charges de la famille ensemble avec Natal. Hermine Vicentia Adjou n'a pas fréquenté l'école pendant longtemps, et s'est arrêtée au niveau primaire. Il y a deux ans de cela que Hermine Vicentia Adjou a commencé la vente de tissus, chaussures et de nounours à son domicile et également par le système de distribution. Hermine Vicentia Adjou s'approvisionne à Cocotomey, à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi à Lomé au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Hermine Vicentia Adjou est à son premier crédit. En effet, Hermine Vicentia Adjou sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter le volume de son activité et accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
H. Hermine Vicentia Adjou was born on November 30, 1972 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to GBAGUIDI Natal, a merchant, and is the mother of four children who are all in school. For four years, she has been living in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou.
