Together with Natal, she is covering family expenses. Hermine Vicentia Adjou hasn’t attended school for a long time, having stopped in primary school. Two years later, she started selling cloth, shoes, and teddy bears at her home and also via the distribution system. She stocks up in Cocotomey, in Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin, and also in Lomé in Togo, a country neighboring Benin. This is her first loan. She’s basically requesting this loan to increase her business volume and to grow her customer base.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two bales of teddy bears, four bolts of cloth, and a dozen shoes

loans.name: Annette

texts.fr: Annette B. est une femme de 30 ans, elle mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE CENTRE depuis 2 ans et demi. Avec son prêt elle développe une activité de restauration; elle vend le petit déjeuné et des légumes tels que des pommes de terre du piment des cacahouètes. Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent de participer partiellement au bien-être de la famille.
texts.en:
Annette B. is a 30-year-old woman who is married and the mother of one child. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE CENTRE for 2½ years. With her loan, she’s developing a restaurant business. She sells breakfast and some vegetables, such as potatoes, chili peppers, and peanuts. The profits she makes enable her to contribute to the family’s well-being.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her commercial work

loans.name: Eric Parfait

texts.fr: A. Eric parfait est né le 18 Avril 1970 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Eric parfait est marié à DOSSOU Djomamou Joseline, une revendeuse. Eric parfait est père de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés ; mais en plus de ses enfants, il a un autre enfant à charge. Depuis une quinzaine d’année, Eric parfait vit à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Eric parfait supporte seul les charges de la famille. C’est pourquoi, il y a neuf ans déjà que Eric parfait mène comme activité la vente d’articles religieux (gravures, livres de prières, chapelets, images des saints, etc.), pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Eric parfait s’approvisionne au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin, et à Cotonou. Pour agrandir son activité et accroître la taille de sa clientèle, Eric parfait sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Eric parfait ambitionne l’ouverture d’une seconde baraque de vente de ses articles.
texts.en:
A. Eric Parfait was born on April 18, 1970 in Ouidah, a historic city of Benin. He is married to DOSSOU Djomamou Joseline, a retailer, and is the father of four children who are all in school; but in addition to his children, he has another child to support. For about 15 years, Eric Parfait has lived in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. He alone is the one who covers the family expenses. This is why he has been running a business for nine years selling religious items (engravings or reproductions, prayer books, rosaries, images of saints, etc.) to provide for his family. He supplies himself in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin, and in Cotonou. To expand his business and to increase his customer base, he’s requesting a loan from ALIDé. His ambition is to open a second stall for selling his items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 boxes of prayer books, 3 dozen rosaries, and 10 engravings

loans.name: Joyce

texts.fr: A. Joyce est née en 1946 au Ghana, État voisin du Bénin. Joyce est mariée et est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Joyce vit seule au quartier Gbodjè à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, depuis cinq ans. Mais les charges de la famille sont supportées par Joyce et son mari Parfait qui est un mécanicien. Joyce a été à l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Depuis une quinzaine d’année, Joyce vend des produits de pharmacopée et également des parfums de façon ambulante. Joyce fait ses approvisionnements au Ghana. Joyce sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé dans l’optique d’agrandir son activité et de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Joyce A. was born in 1946 in Ghana, a country neighboring Benin. Joyce is married and is mother to three children who have attended school. For five years, Joyce has lived alone in Gbodje, a suburb of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital in Benin. The family expenses have been met by Joyce and her husband Parfait, who is a mechanic. Jayce attended school up to the secondary level. For the past fifteen years she has sold natural medicine products and perfumes from door to door. Joyce buys her supplies in Ghana. She is requesting her first loan from ALIDe with the view of increasing her business and to better satisfy her customers needs.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two bags of tree roots, three bags of leaves and 60 empty bottles

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: A. Afi est née en 1954 à Adja au Mono (au Bénin). Mariée à BOTOKOU Sévérin, un revendeur de moutons, Afi est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par les deux conjoints. Afi n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour aider son mari dans les charges de la famille, Afi s'est mise depuis dix ans déjà, à vendre des objets de poterie (canaris, etc.), de même que les plantes de la médecine traditionnelle. Afi fait ses approvisionnements à Cotonou et les vend à cocotomey. Afi est à son premier crédit à ALIDé. Dans le but d'agrandir son activité et de construire plus tard une baraque pour la vente de ses produits, Afi sollicite ce premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Afi was born in 1954 in Adja in Mono (Bénin). Married to BOTOKOU Sévérin, a sheep seller, Afi is the mother of 5 children, some of whom some are enrolled in school. The two spouses share responsibility for supporting the family.

Afi never went to school. In order to help her husband support the family, 10 years ago, Afi began to sell pottery objects (big clay pots called 'canaris', etc.), as well as traditional medicinal plants. Afi stocks up in Cotonou and sells in Cocotomey. She is on her first loan from ALIDé. Wishing to grow her business and later on, build a shed to sell out of, Afi is requesting this first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 30 'canaris', and 8 sacks of leaves and tree bark

loans.name: Jasmina Elibeth

texts.es: Jasmina Elibeth tiene 33 años, su actividad económica es la venta de calzado. Hace más de 11 años que ella decidió conseguir algo de dinero para empezar esta actividad, lo que más le preocupaba era que tenía un niño menor de edad, y no podía salir a vender sus productos porque no podía dejar a su hijo mucho tiempo solo, por lo que todos estos años lucho para salir adelante a pesar de vivir en condiciones muy humildes a ella le gusta mucho trabajar y ganarse el dinero de una manera muy digna. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de sandalias, botas, zapatos de vestir, zapatillas entre otras cosas. El sueño de ella es obtener su propio salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Jasmina Elibeth is 33 years old and her economic activity is selling shoes. It was more than 11 years ago that she decided to obtain some money to start this activity. What most concerned her was that she had a young child, and she couldn't go out and sell her products because she couldn't leave her child alone for long periods. For that reason, for all these years she has struggled to get ahead, in spite of living in very humble conditions. She really likes to work and earn money in a dignified manner.

At present, she requests this financing to buy merchandise -- sandals, boots, dress shoes, and slippers, among other things. Her dream is to obtain her own beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SHOES, SANDALS, AND SLIPPERS TO SELL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anatoliy

texts.en:
Anatoliy is married with one child. He co-owns a small grocery store in Vasilievka town. Anatoliy has been in this business for nine years. His experience helps him run this business well. The store is open 24 hours a day and offers all kinds of food to its customers. Anatoliy offers only good and fresh products and is always looking for more ways to improve client service.

Anatoliy would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase the assortment of products. He hopes to receive additional income and help his daughter pay for college tuition.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of products

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: La señora Erika M. vive en una casa de interés social  con sus tres hijos, ella obtiene ingresos por medio de un pequeño negocio que  tiene en una escuela primaria de venta de dulces, golosinas, refrescos, hielitos, etc. Con este negocio lleva 2 años el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco, requiere este préstamo para poder surtirlo de mercancía nueva por la temporada de invierno que se acerca y así poder seguir dando su servicio a los niños de esta primaria y de cierta manera para seguir teniendo ingresos pues de esto es de lo que ella mantiene a sus pequeños hijos. Ella comenta que siempre ha buscado la manera de sacar a delante a sus hijos aun que sea un pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Erika M. lives in a publicly-subsidized house with her three children. She obtains her income by means of a small business, located in an elementary school, selling sweets, treats, drinks, frozen treats, etc. She has been working with this business for two years, and it has has grown little by little. She needs this loan to be able to supply her business with new merchandise for the winter season that is approaching. Thus, she will be able to continue giving her service to the children of this primary school and also continue having an income because this is what maintains her own young children. She comments that she has always looked for a way to put her children first, even though the business is small.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business

loans.name: Aurora San Juanita

texts.es: La Señora Aurora San Juanita tiene un terreno de su propiedad lo escrituro a nombre de su mamá, este terreno esta en una colonia que apenas se esta habitando y en este tipo de colonias tiende ha llegar los llamados paracaidistas, que es gente que se instala dentro de las propiedades e incluso llegan a construir en los terrenos baldíos sus propias casas sin ser propietarios de dichos terrenos. A ella le preocupa esta situación ya que con tanto esfuerzo se hizo de este terreno y no quiere que gente  como esta invada su propiedad para ello tiene la idea de cercar toda el área de este terreno y así poder ponerlo de cierta manera seguro contra estas personas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aurora San Juanita has her own land, which is in her mother's name. This land is in an area that is not very populated, and in this type of area, squatters have the tendency to appear--these are people who set up homes on empty land that does not belong to them. She is very worried about this situation, as she has put much effort into her land and doesn't want these people invading her property. For this reason, she would like to enclose her property, and make it more secure against these squatters.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enclosure for land

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción tiene 50 años, es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Concepción tuvo ciertos problemas cuando inicio su negocio porque no tenía el capital de suficiente, y además tenía que proporcionarles comida, vestimenta y educación a sus hijos, por lo que tuvo que trabajar mucho para conseguir lo que hoy en día tiene, a pesar de que sus hijos son mayores de edad siempre la apoyan con su negocio. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, pollos, golosinas y jugos. Lo que siempre ha deseado es de ampliar su negocio y aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
Concepción is 50 years old. She is a very responsible and hard working woman. She runs a local shop. She had some problems when she started her business because she did not have enough capital, and in addition had to provide food, clothing and education for her children. She had to work hard to get what she has today. Although her children are now older, they always support her in her business. Concepción is requesting this loan for capital that will be used to purchase rice, sugar, beans, chicken, candy and juice. What she has always wanted to do is expand her business and increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Víctor  Manuel es originario de la comunidad de Paqui  tierra de Atanasio T.  que se encuentra a ocho kilómetros de la ciudad prócer de Totonicapán su principal fuente de ingreso es la elaboración de muebles,  como sillas roperos, camas, puertas y mesas dicha actividad lo fue aprendiendo hace quince años cuando contrajo matrimonio, ya es la actividad de su esposa  conjuntamente  iniciaron su propio negocio, actualmente necesitan un crédito  para aumentar su producción,  lo invertirá en la compra de madera, clavos, barniz pintura cola blanca
texts.en:
Mr. Víctor Manuel is from the community of Paqui in Atanasio T., 8 km outside the city of Totonicapan. His primary source of income is making furniture, such as chairs, wardrobes, beds, doors and tables. He began learning this job 15 years ago when he became engaged. It is now also his wife's job. They've started their own business, and currently need a loan to increase their production. This money will be invested in the purchase of wood, nails, varnish, paint, and glue.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan P. C. lleva tiempo elaborando en su domicilio un cuarto y un baño mismo que realizo de ahorros que junto con su trabajo y parte con el negocio de su esposa, ella se encarga de elaborar y vender nopalitos, semillas y donas esto con el fin de tener mayor ingreso y ayudarle a su esposo. El proyecto que ellos tienen en mente es terminar estos cuartos ya que son muy necesarios, comenta la señora Remedios esposa del señor Juan que esta muy contenta con este proyecto ya que ella le pedía mucho a su esposo que le realizara un baño mejor que el que tienen actual mente, actualmente el proyecto esta semi construido pues el material se termino y los ahorros también, por eso solicitan su ayuda para darle a su Esposa ese baño que ella siempre a querido tener y lucir.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan P. C. has worked for some time trying to finish building a room and a bathroom in his home. He has financed the construction with savings from his job and from his wife's business. She works making and selling nopalitos (a dish made with the prickly pear fruit), seeds, and donuts in order to improve the family income and help her husband. They would like to finish the rooms in their home soon as they are needed for the family. Remedios, Juan's wife, is very pleased with the project since she asked her husband for some time to construct a better bathroom than the one they currently have. Currently, the project is half-finished but they ran out of materials and savings; this is why they are requesting a loan in order to finish the bathroom that Remedios has dreamed of.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building a room and a bathroom

texts.es: Maria Teresa Y. tiene 51 años de edad inicio su negocio hace 15 años vendiento cosas de consumo en menor cantidad hoy en dia su tienda ha crecido y cuenta con clientes que la conocen, además tiene una venta de frutas fuera de su tienda, también se dedica a la siembra de verduras, ella dice que es una buena época para invertir y que los créditos le han ayudado para levantar su negocio asi que ella hace planes de cómo invertir mejor el dinero y poder aprovechar bien la oportunidad que se le da . ella  desea siempre seguir mejorando ya que apoya a sus hijos que son 6 y también es un apoyo para su esposo, ya que siempre esta dispuesta a trabajar duro para que su familia tenga mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa Y. is 51 years old and started her business selling food 15 years ago. Today, her store has expanded and she has many customers who are familiar with her, in addition to having a fruit stand apart from her store, and growing vegetables. She says now is a good time to invest and that the loans she’s received so far have helped her improve her store. She has plans to better invest the money and to be able to take advantage of the opportunities with which the loans provide her. Her wish is to always strive for improvement, as she supports her 6 children and her husband. She is willing to always work hard so that her family may enjoy better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Eva Cayetana

texts.es: La Señorita Eva es originaria de la comunidad de Chuipache lugar muy hermoso por los bosque de San Miguel Totonicapán  su principal fuente de ingreso es la venta y compra y crianza de animales domésticos inicio su propio negocio hace cuatro años  sus principales lugares de ventas  son: Totonicapán, San Francisco el Alto y salcaja Quetzaltenango actualmente necesita de un crédito que le servirá para ampliar su capital y aprovechar la época de fin de año  donde las ventas incrementas y con las ganancias que obtiene le permitirá  mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Eva is from the community of Chuipache, a beautiful place near the forests of San Miguel Totonicapán. Her main source of income is the selling, purchasing and breeding of domestic animals. She started her business 4 years ago and she most of her transactions take place in Totonicapán, San Francisco el Alto and Quetzaltenango. She currently requires a loan, which will help her increase her working capital and take advantage of the end of the year, when sales increase. With the earnings from this she will be able to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena K. is married and has one adult son. She sells curtains and other house decoration items at one of the markets in Zaporozhye.

Olena has been in this business for 15 years, during which time she has developed her business well. Today she has three business locations at the market where she offers a variety of good quality products to her clients.

Olena would like to borrow 11300 UAH to purchase more inventory. She hopes to receive additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov K. is married and has two sons. She runs a small retail business that offers a wide range of practical products from tape and screwdrivers to flashlights and electric cords.

Lubov has been in this business for 12 years. For the last couple of years, the business has become a family one. Lubov's husband and children have joined her to help in sales and deliveries. Low prices and a large assortment help them to overcome the competition.

Lubov has requested a loan of 10000 UAH to purchase more inventory for her business. Her business goal is to purchase a kiosk to sell her goods. The kiosk would also serve as storage place.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia N. is married with three children. She has a small cafe located at the central market in Vinogradovo.

She used to sell small home products at the same market. Because of high competition she decided to take a risk and change her business. She began to provide other market vendors with food. This became a stable source of income for Natalia and her family.

Natalia would like to borrow 12500 UAH to increase the assortment at her cafe. Her business goal is to start a second location and increase the sales.

loans.use: To increase the variety ar her cafe.

loans.name: Sara Marìa

texts.es:
SARA MARIA T. TOXCON  tiene 27 años de edad inicio con su negocio a los  20 años con la ayuda de la persona para quien trabaja  de ahí empezó su pequeña tienda, su hermana le ayudaba a atenderla mientras  Sara trabaja  para poder comprar mas artículos  porque cada día los clientes pedían mas cosas  y lo que ella ganaba lo invertía  en su tienda,  es soltera y vive con sus padres.  Ella quiere aprovechar la época de inicios de noviembre y diciembre ya que ese día llegan muchos visitantes y aprovecha para poner un pequeño comedor  y también  para su tienda comprar más productos para su tienda.

Ella sigue luchando y trabajando duro ya que su mayor sueño es tener un terreno propio, quiere que su negocio crezca y en el futuro tenga los recursos para abrir una librería.
texts.en:
Sara Maria T. Toxcon is 27 years old and started her business when she was 20, with the aid of the person for whom she works. She opened a small store, which her sister tends, while Sara works so she may purchase items to keep up with her customers’ increasing demands; whatever she earns she invests in her store. She is single and lives with her parents, and would like to take advantage of the November/December season, as there is an increase in tourism at this time. She wants to open up a small dining room and purchase more products for her store. She works extremely hard, as her biggest dream is to have a small plot of land, to have her business grow and in the future have the resources to open up a bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock for store

loans.name: Gloria Judith

texts.es: La señora Gloria Judith es originaria de la comunidad de chotacaj  a cuatro kilometros de la ciudad de Totonicapan  su principal actividad es maestra de educacion primaria, trabaja en una escuela oficial del gobierno, hace cinco años inicio su propio negocio que consiste en una cafeteria, que los atiende  por la tarde y los fines de semana, hoy necesita de un credito para sustir su cafeteria, y poder mejora su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Judith is from the community of Chotacaj, located 4 km from the city of Totonicapan. Her main occupation is primary school teacher, and she works in a government-run school. Five years ago she started her own business, a café, which she tends in the afternoons and on weekends. She currently needs a loan to stock her café and to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital

loans.name: Lesvia Patricia

texts.es: Patricia nació el 31 de marzo de 1967 en Guatemala tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos uno de 17 otro de 12 y el menor de 7 años, tiene 8 años de vender comida ( Tacos Mexicanos) y 10 años de trabajar con FAPE. Inicio con un capital de Q500.00 y poco a poco fue incrementando sus ganancias y ahora le solicita a FAPE un préstamo por la cantidad de  Q 4,000.00 invertir mas en su negocio de comida y obtener mejores ganancias ya que quiere darle un mejor estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Patricia was born on March 31, 1967 in Guatemala. She is 42 years old, is married and has 3 children -- ages 17, 12 and 7. She has been selling food (Mexican tacos) for 8 years and has spent 10 years working with FAPE. She started with a capital of Q 500.00 and gradually increased her profits and now is asking FAPE for a loan in the amount of Q 4000.00 to invest more in her food business and get better returns because she wants to give a better education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Venta de Refacciones

loans.name: Juana Teresa

texts.es: Doña Juanita como es conocidad en su comunidad de cojxac Totonicapan ser una persona muy sencilla ella es madre soltera con tres hijos actualmete tiene dos fuentes  de ingreso como domesticos y costurera con los ingreso  puede mejorar  su condiciones de vida y la de su familia hoy necesita de un credito,que sera invertido en la compra de materiales, ya que su dos hijas culminaron el ciclo escolar 2009 para aprovechar el tiempo para que sus hijas trabajen en la epocas de vacaciones para pode contribuir en los ingreso de la familia.
texts.en:
The lady Juanita, as is known in her community of Totonicapan cojxac, is a very simple person. She is a single mother with three children. At the moment, she has two sources of income as a domestic worker and a seamstress. She hopes the income may improve their living conditions, and so her family today needs a loan, which will be invested in the purchase of materials. Her two daughters have already completed the 2009 school year, in order to use the time for her daughters to work during the holiday season and contribute to the family income.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making embroidery

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya T. is a widow. She has a grown son. She lives and works in Novomoskovsk.

Natalya started her small venture selling footwear in the central market 14 years ago. Since then she has grown her business to 15000 UAH in inventory and her business is constantly growing. Natalya realizes lending services are very helpful to her business as loans allow her to increase her turnover capital and grow her business even further.

Natalya is requesting a loan of 6400 UAH to purchase additional merchandise and expand her trade.

She is hoping to generate enough profit to keep her business running and improve her living standard as a result.

loans.use: To develop her trade.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las rosas, son personas agradables, sociables y con deseos de salir adelante,  vecinas cercanas. a continuacion se detalla cada una de las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

NANCY tiene dos años de dedicarse a minipulperia, se levanta a las seis de la mañana para comezar a atender a sus clientes ella vende refrescos, jugos, jabon, azucar, café, salsas, churros pañales, pan palomitas entre otros,  vive con su hijo de un año y su esposo quien trabaja de motorista, ella solicita el credito para comprar manteca arroz, espaguettis, refrescos, churros, salsa ya que necesita surtir mas su pulperia, ahora cuenta con poco producto y necesita surtir mas para obtener mejores utilidades, su meta es poder convertir su Minipulperia en un mercadito. 
DOÑA EDIS tiene un año de dedicarse a la venta de mercaderia nueva y usada como ser carteras, zapatos de caballero y de dama, asi mismo vende todo tipo de camisas formales juveniles de moda, ya que tiene clientes fijos, igual sale venderle a sus vecinos de casa en casa y visita zonas aledañas 
Edis vende $ 1,022.00 y compra $601.00 obteniendo una utilidad mensual de $ 421.00 
ella vive con su hijo de 15 años quien cursa el 2do año de cliclo común ya que la meta de ella es graduarlo, su esposo trabaja en los estados unidos desde hace 12 años el le envia remesas y de esta forma logra salir con todas las necesidades de ella y su hijo. Edis solicita el credito para comprar carteras. Zapatos de dama y caballero, viene una temporada alta y de esta forma obtener mejores ganancias.
KAREN tiene 13 años de dedicarse  a la venta de tortillas todo el dia, se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana a elaborar las tortillas, desde niña le ha gustado el negocio, ella vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Karen  vende diario $ 23.00 y gasta $ 12.00 obteniendo una utilidad de $ 11.00 necesita el credito para comprar maiz, leña, cal, pailas plasticas.
y DOÑA DENIA tiene 51 años de edad, tiene 14 años de dedicarse  a elaboracion y venta de tortillas las cuales las entrega en una cafeteria del aereopuerto de tegucigalpa,  se las piden para tacos tiene sus clientes fijos tambien que les entrega diario $ 15.00 y ella gasta $ 7.00 obteniendo una ganacia de $ 8.00 ella vive con su esposo quien labora en una empresa privada como motorista el sueño de la cliente es poder vender cada día mas y de esta forma obtener mejores ganancias. ella solicita el apoyo a la istitucion para comprar maiz, leña, servilletas.
texts.en:
The group Las Rosas are close neighbors who are pleasant, sociable people who have a desire to improve their standard of living. Following below is more detail about each of the different activities they carry out:

NANCY has been making her living for two years by running a neighborhood grocery. She gets up at six in the morning to start helping her customers. She sells soft drinks, juices, soap, sugar, coffee, salsas and traditional baked goods, among other things. She lives with her 1-year old son and her husband, who works as a driver. She is requesting the loan to purchase butter, rice, spaghetti, soft drinks, baked goods and salsa because she needs to stock her grocery. Right now she has little in the way of products and needs to increase her stock in order to make a better profit. Her goal is to be able to convert her neighborhood grocery into a small market. DOÑA EDIS has been making her living for two years by selling new and used merchandise such as wallets and ladies' and men's shoes as well as all manner of fashionable, formal children's shirts. Even though she has steady customers, she also goes house to house to sell to her neighbors and visits nearby regions. Edis sells $1,022.00 in merchandise and purchases $601.00 in merchandise which gives her a monthly profit of $421.00. She lives with her 15-year old son who is in his 2nd year of secondary school; her goal is to help him graduate. Her husband has been working in the United States for 12 years. He sends her remittances, and in this way she is able to meet her and her son's needs. Edis is requesting the loan in order to purchase wallets and ladies' and men's shoes. The high season is coming and this way she will be able to make a better profit. KAREN has been making her living for 13 years by selling tortillas all day long. She gets up at four in the morning to make the tortillas. She has liked this business since she was a young girl. She lives with her husband and her three children. Karen has $23.00 in daily sales and spends $12.00, so earns a profit of $11.00. She needs the loan in order to purchase corn, firewood, lime and plastic basins. and DOÑA DENIA is 51 years old. She has been making her living for 14 years by making and selling tortillas, which she delivers to an airport cafeteria in Tegucigalpa. Her tortillas are requested for tacos. She also has steady clients who pay her $15.00 a day; she spends $7.00, leaving an earnings of $8.00. She lives with her husband who works as a driver in a private company. This client's dream is to be able to sell more each day and make a better profit. She is requesting the support of the institution in order to purchase corn, firewood and napkins.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing corn, firewood, butter, blankets, plastic basins, wallets and ladies' and men's shoes

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Our client is Juana. Juana is from Ccorao. She is 44 years old and is married with 3 children (2 boys and 1 girl). 

Juana is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. 

This is Juana’s third loan from Arariwa. She splits her time between selling grains like quinoa in the market and selling artisan clothing to tourists. 

She sells approximately 50 PEN worth of grain each Sunday and 150 PEN of clothing each week. The clothing is hand-made. She will split this loan for use, buying merchandise for both her grain and her artisan goods business.

Juana appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more grain and artisan goods to sell.

loans.name: Yana

texts.en:
Yana is married with two sons and lives in Novomoskovsk

Yana sells women’s clothing in the central marketplace and has been in this trade for 10 years. She offers a variety of merchandise for sale in her kiosk. Presently, she has 20,000 Grivnyas invested in her stock.

Yana is seeking a 9,300 Grivnyas loan to give her some additional working capital to purchase inventory and grow her sales.

Yana is very consistent and focused. She has maintained a perfect credit history with “Nadiya Ukraine”. The financial wisdom she has demonstrated is one of many reasons why her business has been successful and we believe it will continue to be in the future.

loans.use: To grow her business

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma es casada, tiene 3 hijos mayores que viven en forma independiente, pues, todos ya están casados y tienen su casa propia, ella es una señora con 61 años y sigue teniendo ganas de superación.

Ella monto su despensa en el año 2000, ya que es la única actividad que le gustaba, era docente y hoy día vive de la jubilación y su actividad  es el comercio. 

Su máximo sueño es refaccionar su casa porque hasta ahora sigue teniendo de madera y alguna vez piensa modificar por uno de material.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma is married and has 3 children who are all married and have homes of their own. She is 61 years old and still has aspirations to better herself. She opened her grocery store in 2000, as it is the only activity that she enjoyed. She was a teacher and is nowadays living off retirement and her main activity is commerce. Her biggest dream is to repair her home as it is currently still made of wood, and would like to refurbish it with sturdier materials.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Jose Ariel

texts.es:
Ariel es una persona joven, soltero, que aun vive con sus padres, el tiene muchos deseos de superación.

Actualmente está cursando el 4 año de la carrera de contabilidad en una universidad privada a la cual asiste en horario nocturno.

El tiene una bodega donde vende todo tipo de bebidas.

Se inicio en el ramo con un capital que consiguió con la liquidación de  un trabajo que realizaba como vendedor en un negocio.

También su padre le ayudo con un poco de efectivo para aumentar su capital.
El es muy trabajador con buenas referencias en el mercado y merece una oportunidad para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ariel is a single young man who still lives with his parents. He is eager to succeed.

At the moment, Ariel is completing a 4 year degree in accounting at a private university. He attends classes at night.

He manages a warehouse where he sells all types of beverages. Ariel started this business with the severance pay he received when his previous employer went out of business. He had previously worked as a sales representative. His father also provided some additional cash to help increase his capital.

Ariel is a hard worker with good references in the marketplace. He deserves the opportunity to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages (beer, sodas, mineral water, wine, etc.)

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Our client is Celia. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. She is from Ccorao.  She is 40 years old and is married with six children who are studying in Cusco.

She has been working with Arariwa, a Kiva partner, for five years.  She splits her time between selling tires and cameras. She works with her husband who replaces tires. Her clients come to her husband’s shop asking for tires, so they work together. She sells approximately 210 – 300 soles worth of tires each week to car owners in Cusco, which is the equivalent of $73 - 105. She will use this loan to buy more tires to sell to her clients.

Celia appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy tires for her tire business

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with a son. He is a businessman from Novomoskovsk, where he runs a small trade selling office supplies. Sergei owns a kiosk in the central city market. He launched his trade 10 years ago. Currently, he has about 35,000 Grivnyas invested in his business. 

Sergei is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to expand his trade. He is hoping to generate enough income and savings to open new vending locations in the near future. Sergei is known as a consistent and honest entrepreneur who tries to have a proactive attitude in life. We believe Sergei will have no trouble repaying this loan.

loans.use: To develop his business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
la sra. Veronica L. E. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en la colonia sagastume de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, su negocio es la confeccion de trajes para dama, vestidos para boda y vestidos para 15 años.
Veronica tiene una hija y en estos momentos ella le paga los estudios ya que su esposo no esta trabajando, nos comento que le ha costado mucho conseguir empleo ya que la situacion que vive nuestro pais es un poco dificil y Veronica esta viendo la forma de tener mejores ganancias. esta es su unica fuente de ingresos. Veronica necesita el credito para la compra de materia prima para la fabricacion de sus vestidos, nos comento que para esta epoca navideña dice que fabrica varios vestidos y tiene que tener listos los materiales para dicho compromiso.
texts.en:
Sra. Veronica L. E. is 37 years old and lives in the subdivision of Sagastume in the city of Tegucigalpa. Her business involves making women’s clothing, wedding dresses, and evening gowns and she has been doing this for 15 years.

Veronica has a daughter whose education she is funding because her husband is not working. She says he is not able to find a job because the economic situation in the country is difficult, so she is looking for ways to generate better earnings. At the moment, Veronica’s business is her only source of income.

She is requesting a loan to purchase materials for making dresses. Veronica says that she makes different types of clothes for the Christmas season, so she wants to have materials on hand so that she can fill orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, buttons, lace, sponges, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Our client is Maria.  She is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco.  The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. She is from Ccorao. She is 40 years old and married with three children who are studying.

She has been working with Arariwa, a Kiva partner, for two years.  She sells dry goods like wheat, quinoa and beans in the San Sebatian market. She sells approximately 40 soles worth of goods each day, which is the equivalent of $14. She buys her goods from wholesalers in Cusco. She will use this loan to buy more dry goods to sell.

Maria appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy dry goods for her market stall

loans.name: Kare Amandy

texts.es:
Kare Amandy G. B. tiene 26 años de edad, tiene un negocio de venta de lenceria fina, Kare fabrica las pulseras y los collares con decoracion de piedras brillantes y plata. Kare tiene un taller en el cual fabrica dichas piezas, tiene 3 personas a su cargo que le ayudan a la fabricacion de sus joyas. esta es su unica fuente de ingresos.
este negocio es muy bueno ya que su producto es bien vendido, muchas mujeres ahora compran este tipo de producto por ser barato y muy bonito. 
las muchachas tambien venden el prodcuto y tienen comision por cada venta, esto hace que se venda mas el prodcuto rapido.
kare tiene dos hijos uno esta en la escuela y el otro esta pequeño, tiene que cuidarlo todo el dia. su taller queda en su casa de habitacion asi que no descuida a su hijo.
ella le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
nos comento que su meta es poder fabricar muchos collares y pulseras para distribuirlo en diferentes departamentos de nuestro pais.
texts.en:
Kare Amandy G. B. is 26 years old and has a business selling fine lingerie. She also makes bracelets and necklaces decorated with glittering stones and silver. Kare has a workshop where she employs three assistants who help her make the jewelry. These businesses are her only sources of income. Her products sell very well. Many women buy them because they are inexpensive and stylish. Her employees also sell these products and earn a commission, which means her inventory sells even more quickly.

Kare has two children. One is in school and the other one is still young, so she has to look after him all day. Her workshop is located in her home, so she is able to keep an eye on him. Her income enables her to help her husband with the household expenses. Kare told us that one of her goals is to produce as many necklaces and bracelets as possible for distribution to other districts within the country.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase necklaces, earrings, bracelets, chains, rings, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cristhiam Guadalupe

texts.es: Cristhiam de 37 años de edad es soltera, tiene una niña de 4 años de edad, trabaja para el MINED como maestra de primaria desde hace 20 años, esta solicitando su 7mo credito para continuar mejorando su casa, pues anteriormente ya habia sido beneficiada con KIVA pero no logro terminar con la construccion, tiene los materiales pero no cuenta con el suficiente dinero para comprar las puertas y ventanas, ademas del pago de la mano de obra, por lo que solicita se le financie el credito y asi lograr darle mejores condiciones de vida a su bebita que es la razon de su vida y a quien desea darle las mejores condiciones para que crezca en un ambiente comodo y agradable.
texts.en:
Cristhiam is a 37 year old single woman. She has a four year old daughter. She has worked for MINED as a grade school teacher for twenty years. She is requesting this seven month loan to continue improving her house. She has previously been a beneficiary of Kiva, but she was unable to finish the construction. She has the materials, but she does not have sufficient money to buy the doors and windows, or further to pay for the labor. This is why she is requesting the financing of this loan in order to manage to give her young daughter better living conditions (who is the reason for her life) and who she wants to give an environment that is comfortable and pleasant.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy housing construction materials

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Our client is Teresa. Teresa is from Ccorao. She is 56 years old and is married with 5 children and 4 grandchildren.

Teresa is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita D. Belen D. Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru.

This is Teresa’s second loan from Arariwa. She sells artisan clothing – sweaters, coats and pants – to tourists in Ccorao from her house. She sells approximately 150-600 PEN worth of goods each day, which is the equivalent of $52-210. She buys her goods from Cusco.

She will use this loan to buy more artisan clothing to sell.

Teresa appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy artisan clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
la sra. Rosa Elia M. tiene 54 años de edad, vive en la colonia sagastume de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa. tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva para cama, desodorantes, camisas y blusas.
quiere comprar cosmeticos para vender en la epoca de navidad.
a parte de vender su ropa, los fines de semana hace nacatamales por encargo, el viernes en la noche empieza a preparar los ingredientes para hacer los nacatamales los cuales el sabado temprano ya los tiene listos para venderlos. dicho alimento se vende bastante ya que es muy rico de sabor, un nacatamal se puede comer en los tres tiempos de comida. muchas personas prefieren comerlo de desayuno.
con estos negocios ella ha logrado mantener a su familia y su hogar, ella desea el credito para invertirlo en ropa para la epoca de navidad.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Elia M. is a 54-year-old woman who lives in the Sagastume housing development in the city of Tegucigalpa. She has her own business in which she sells bed linen, deodorant, shirts and blouses. She would like to purchase cosmetics in order to sell them during the Christmas season. Aside from selling clothing, she also makes nacatamales—Central American tamales—by special order on weekends. She starts preparing the ingredients for the nacatamales on Friday night, then has them ready by early Saturday morning to sell them. This dish is very popular because it is so delicious and can be eaten throughout the day. However, many people prefer to eat nacatamales for breakfast. With these two businesses, she has managed to support her household. She would like this loan in order to invest it in purchasing clothes for the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bed linen, deodorant, footwear, shirts, blouses, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cándido Eligio

texts.es:
El señor Cándido es casado, tiene 6 hijos mayores, los cuales todos trabajan y le apoyan en su emprendimiento, su señora es la que más ayuda en el negocio, porque él también se dedica en la venta de pinturas para cabellos durante la mañana. Es un señor muy activo. Tiene 58 años y recién a esta edad va en constante progreso ya que nadie depende de él y su única inversión es la refacción de su vivienda.

El señor Cándido tiene como sueño aumentar su ingreso para tener una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernandez is a married father with 6 grown children who all work and help out with his enterprise. His wife, however, is the one who helps him the most with his business. He also sells hair dyes for a living during the day. He is a very active man. He is 58 years old and is making progress at this age because he has no dependents; his only investment is refurbishing his house.

Mr. Fernandez dreams of increasing his income so that he can have a more decent life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, cooking oil, notebooks, pens, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Don Rosa V. es casado, es pequeño ganadero del municipio de La Gateada, tiene 2 niños, una niña de 9 años estudiando la primaria y un pequeñito de 2 añitos, su esposa se encarga del cuido de los niños y ademas vende cosmeticos de la AVON para apoyar con los gastos del hogar, don Rosa adquirio una vivienda en Juigalpa en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan pues desea que sus niños estudien y se preparen en esta ciudad, por lo que desea dar mayores condiciones a la casa para vivir con su familia, esta solicitando a AFODENIC su primer credito para la construccion de una habitacion en la casa y si es posible construir la tapia en su propiedad y asi dar mayor seguridad a su familia.  El mayor sueño de don Rosa es ver a sus hijos crecer sanos y que puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Mr. Rosa V. is a small-scale livestock farmer in the municipality of La Gateada. He is married and has 2 children—a 9-year-old daughter who is in elementary school, and a 2-year-old son. His wife both takes care of the children and sells AVON cosmetics to help out with the household expenses. Mr. Rosa managed to obtain a home in Juigalpa’s Bosques de Juigalpan residential area because he wants his children to study and grow up in this city. He wants to make home improvements so that he can live comfortably with his family. He is requesting his first loan from AFODENIC so that he can build an extra room in his house, and if possible, build a fence around his property to provide more safety for his family. Mr. Rosa’s greatest wish is to see his children grow up healthy and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Room construction

loans.name: Alex Mauricio

texts.es:
el joven Alex Mauricio C. C. se dedica a la venta de producto de consumo popular, el tiene una pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de DA "SONIA". esta pulperia es su unica fuente de ingresos, el nos comento que este negocio es muy bueno ya que esta ubicado en un punto estrategico, por ahi pasan muchas personas ya que queda cerca de una estacion de buses.
se siente muy feliz ya que a su corta edad logro poner su negocio propio, dice que trae en la sangre el ser comerciante.
texts.en:
Alex Mauricio C. C. sells basic need items for a living. He owns a general store called DA "SONIA," which is his sole source of income. He states that his business is very prosperous because it is located in a very strategic location with a lot of foot traffic from the nearby bus station.

He feels very content because at his young age, he has been able to launch his own business. He says that retail is in his blood.

He wants to purchase beverages, churros (fried dough pastries), pills, sardines, pasta, lard, cooking oil, eggs, bread, milk, coffee, cookies, candy, beans, rice, sugar, sausages, butter, ham, bologna, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en:
Our client is Luz Marina. Luz is from Ccorao. She is 33 years old and is a single mother with 2 children who study in primary school.

Luz is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. She is the fiscal officer of the group.

This is Luz’s second loan from Arariwa. She sells candy to tourists in Ccorao and also raises cuyes (guinea pigs). She sells approximately 20-30 PEN worth of candy each day, which is the equivalent of $7-10. She buys her goods from stores in Cusco. She will use this loan as working capital for her candy business.

Luz Marina appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time

loans.use: Working capital for her candy business.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.en:
Ana Maria B. lives in the Tacambu neighborhood with her husband and three of their children. The oldest is already married and has a house of his own.

She gets up early every day for housework and then goes to her beauty salon that is located a few blocks from her home.

Since childhood Ana wanted to learn how to run a beauty salon and was always attracted to selling clothes and shoes. When her husband was younger, he was a champion on the football and soccer field, and he wanted to be a soccer player and coach. However, being a soccer coach couldn’t support his family entirely, so Ana decided to get a career in hairdressing and selling shoes.

She started with a small living room in their house, and then, in order to provide greater comfort to her clients, she began to buy more furniture, hairdryers, irons, mirrors, etc. Then her husband sold shoes and they were very successful.

When they wanted to make the business larger he went to Buenos Aires to bring seasonal clothing back to sell. Their sales continued with great success, and so the couple moved forward with good fortune, and all 3 of their children finished their studies. The first is a Customs Agent who has been married for 3 years. The second son is a student of business administration, and the third is a professional makeup artist who also helps at home and works at the Beauty Salon to meet clients.

Ana washes hair and gives haircuts, massages, facials, and waxing, and gives advice on trendy shoes. With the loan they want to buy more shampoo, creams, and other materials for the salon, and clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more shampoo, creams, etc. for the salon, and clothes to sell.

loans.name: María Emilia

texts.es:
La Señora María Emilia C. P. ,madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad
 Domiciliada en el km 7 Cuidad Nueva, se dedica a la venta  ambulante de calzados  Usados.

Se trata de una persona honesta y trabajadora, tal crédito solicitado es para la inversión de una despensa en su domicilio, y más aun considerando que no hay ninguna  en las inmediaciones de su comunidad. Es una persona con moralidad de pago que se ve reflejado en sus históricos de pagos con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Emilia C. Perez lives in Km 7 Ciudad Nueva and has 2 grown children. She sells used footwear as a street vendor for a living.

She is a very honest and hard-working person. She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in an in-home general store, especially since there are none in the vicinity. She is very responsible in making her payments, which is reflected in her credit history with Fundación Paraguaya.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase used footwear for men, women and children

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Our client is Sabina. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. Sabina is from Ccorao. She is 36 years old and is married with 2 children who study in primary and secondary school.

Sabina has been working with Arariwa since 2004. She sells artisan paintings that she paints in her home studio. She sells her paintings to large art stores - sometimes even stores in Chile ask her to send paintings to sell in their stores. She will use this loan to buy artist supplies for her artisan painting business. 100 grams of paint can cost from 125 – 150 soles. She buys her supplies from Lima because it’s more economical. Sabina appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy artist supplies for her artisan painting business

loans.name: De Las Nieves

texts.es: La Señora De Las Nieves O., es madre de un hijo menor, su domicilio particular se encuentra en el Barrio San Agustín de Ciudad del Este, se dedica a manicura y pedicuro en la peluquería de su hermana en el micro centro de la ciudad, también cuenta con un local de ventas de ropas, tal crédito solicitado destinara a la compra de mercaderías tales como  ropas y frazadas, se trata de una persona con un excelente comportamiento de pago reflejado en sus antecedentes con nuestra empresa.
texts.en:
Ms. De Las Nieves O. has a young child. She lives in the San Agustín neighborhood in Ciudad del Este. She works a manicurist/pedicurist at her sister’s beauty salon downtown, but she also has her own apparel boutique. She will be using this loan to purchase merchandise, such as clothing and blankets. She has had an excellent repayment history with her previous loans from our institute.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apparel and blankets

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.en: Alba Marina, 51, is single and has four children all over 24 years old. Her children are not dependent upon her.  A proud mother, Alba says that her dreams have been realized in seeing to the education of all of her children, and even seeing them start their own businesses. For 30 years she has maintained a small book store as her principle source of income. Her store is stocked with school supplies, cosmetics, kitchen items, and miscellaneous items. This loan will go towards the purchase of more inventory.  Her business is challenged by slow sales and increasing taxes. To date, Alba has maintained an excellent credit history.

loans.use: working capital for more inventory

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Elena O. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en la cual vende una variedad de prodcutos, en estos momentos no tiene muy surtido su negocio y por tal razon necesita el credito, desea comprar mercaderia al por mayor, Maria es una persona luchadora y tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante, quiere que su negocio crezca y asi poder tener otra calidad de vida.
su meta o sueño es poder tener un negocio grande en el cual pueda dar empleo  a varias personas, ya que en este pais uno de los problemas es el desempleo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elena O. sells consumer goods. She has a store in which she sells a variety of products but right now she doesn't have much inventory and needs the loan to buy wholesale merchandise. Maria is a fighter and really wants to get ahead. She wants her business to grow so that she can improve her quality of life. Her dream is to have a large business that will employ other people since in her country one of the problems is unemployment.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodas, snacks, rice, beans and other grocery items

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sohar Griselda

texts.es:
la sra. Sohar T. se dedica a la venta de agua en bolsa y refrescos, en esta ciudad de choluteca es muy caliente el clima, esto hace que las personas compren mucha agua y refrescos, es buen negocio, Sohar se siente muy feliz porque hace poco fue que decidio poner este tipo de negocio y hasta ahora todo va muy bien, cada dia que pasa siente que su negocio va creciendo poco a poco.
ahorita necesita el credito para comprar mas agua y refrescos, tiene pensado en un futuro poner un deposito en el cual pueda vender muchos productos liquidos.
fue agradable haber platicado con Sohar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sohar T. sells water and sodas in plastic bags. In the city of Choluteca it is very hot and that makes people buy a lot of water and soft drinks. It's a good business. Sohar is very happy since she decided to start this kind of business a short while ago and it is going very well. Each day she feels her business is growing a bit. She needs the loan right now to buy more water and sodas. In the future she would like to set up a store in which she could sell all different liquid products. It was pleasant to talk with Sohar.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mallku Irpiri Group

texts.es:
Paola H. de 23 años, casada y madre de 2 niños, comenta que ingresó al grupo Mallku Irpiri, por invitación de una amiga ya que ella necesitaba dinero para ampliar su negocio, ella  vende comida en la zona Adrián Castillo que queda cerca al Centro Focal German Busch, vende todos los días de 7  a 11 de la mañana, a veces tiene la ayuda de su esposo, en esta ocasión necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, fideo, papa con los cuales prepara la comida.
Las demás integrantes también tienen sus propias actividades económicas como la venta plásticos, alimentos secos y otros. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
Paola H. is 23, married, and the mother of 2 children. She says that when she joined the Mallku Irpiri group, it was through the invitation from a friend since she needed money to expand her business. She sells food in the Adrián Castillo zone that is near the German Busch center. She sells every day from 7-11 a.m. Sometimes she has the help of her husband. She needs this loan to buy supplies like rice, noodles, and potatoes, which she will use to prepare her food. The other members also have their own economic activities like plastic sales, dried food sales, etc. All of them need this loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL CAMINO AL ÉXITO

Rubi D. se dedica a la costura y compostura D. prendas D. vestir, ella empezó capacitándose desD. muy joven,  luego cuando nacieron sus hijos tuvo la necesidad  D. trabajar y colaborar con los gastos familiares, es por ello que puso en práctica lo aprendido, empezó haciendo compostura D. ropa que llevaban a su casa, y tiempo después confeccionando y vendiéndola entre sus familiares y vecinos. La socia ya tiene experiencia en ese rubro es por eso que enseña a sus compañeras para que puedan tener algún ingreso extra para su casa, ella es la presidenta D. la Alcancía Comunal. 
La tesorera es Constantina P. tiene un bazar hace 10 años, ella  comenzó su negocio vendiendo ambulatoriamente, fue muy difícil esa situación hasta que municipalidad les otorgo un terreno donD. podían establecerse todos los ambulantes, fue ahí donD. ella adquirió su puesto y  puso un bazar, negocio que hasta hoy mantiene, pero eso no es todo en lo que ella se desempeña ya que en sus momentos libres Constantina teje bolsos a crochet eso lo aprendió en un mercado donD. compra sus hilos para tejer, hace diferentes tipos D. bolsos que ahora ella y otras personas tienen la oportunidad exportar a México y Venezuela.
Orfelinda tiene su negocio según la estación en verano,  venD. bebidas heladas, pero en invierno venD. chocolate o mates calientes  ella es la secretaria D. grupo.
Todas son responsables y se consideran especiales porque mediante trabajos honrados pueden brindar a sus familias lo necesario,  pero también necesitan el crédito para seguir invirtiendo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
CAMINO AL ÉXITO (Road to Success) COMMUNAL BANK

Rubi D. is engaged in the making and repair of clothing. She began learning this skill at a very young age. Then, when her children were born, it was necessary to work and help with the family expenses; so she put into practice what she had learned. She began making repairs to clothing that was taken to her house and, after some time, began making and selling clothes for her friends and neighbors. Since Rubi already has experience in this field she is teaching other members so that they are able to have extra income for their households. She is the president of the Communal Bank.

The treasurer is Constantina P.. For 10 years, she has had a shop. She began her business selling on an itinerant basis. This was a very difficult situation until the municipality provided an area where all the itinerant businesses could establish themselves. It was there that she acquired a stall and put in her shop, the business that she has operated until now, but that is not all she does. In her free time, Constantina crochets bags. She learned this in a market where she brought yarn for weaving. She makes different types of bags, and now she and other persons have the opportunity to export these to Mexico and Venezuela.

Orfelinda operates her business according to the season. In the summer, she sells cold drinks. In the winter she sells hot chocolate or mate. She is the group’s secretary.

All are responsible and consider themselves fortunate because by means of honorable work they can offer their families the necessities of life. They need this loan in order to continue investing in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of products for their businesses

loans.name: Jose De Los Santos

texts.es:
JOSE DE LOS SANTOS DUARTES C. . Su actividad principal es el comercio El cosecha compra y vende café bananos y platanos desde hace mas de 10 años. con las ganancias que ha tenido logro montar una pulperia, ya que la cosecha no es todo el año, y esta pulperia es su negocio de todos los dias.
durante este tiempo el ha ido adquiriendo experiencia y buena clientela, de esta manera va saliendo adelante con su negocio y atesorando el bienestar para su familia.
El Sr D. esta casado tiene una hija de 4 años la cual esta en la preparatoria en un kinder de la ciudad de danli. 
con los ingresos de su negocio de genera, cubre sus gastos familiares y las obligaciones finanacieras.
. anteriormente logro establecer una pequeña pulperia la que piensa surtir con este credito que esta solicitando para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y asi mejorar sus ventas y obtener buenas ganancias
texts.en:
José de los Santos Duartes C. has been buying and selling coffee, bananas, and plantains for more than 10 years. Using his earnings, he opened a grocery store so that he could generate income during those periods when harvest season was not in session. He looks after the store every day. During this time, José has gained experience and established a good customer base. He is positioned to move his business forward and establish savings for the welfare of his family.

José is married and has a four year old daughter who attends kindergarten in the city of Danli. With the revenue he generates from his business, he is able to cover his family expenses and other financial obligations. His previous loan was used to establish his business. With this new loan, he plans to acquire more merchandise so that he can meet the demands of his customers, improve his sales, and obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise for his store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
le sr. MIGUEL ANGEL Z. H. tiene 24 años de dedicarse la elaboracion y venta de bloques de concreto para construccion de casas y edificios , este producto tiene mucha demanda en la zona
ya que la mayoria de las construcciones emplean este tipo de material por ser mas economico y resistente
El Sr. Z. nos manifesto que este negocio le es de mucha bendicion ya que le ha generado ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales y las obligaciones finanacieras que el ha contraido. Su esposa a sido de gran apoyo para salir adelante con su pequeña empresa.
su meta es poder fabricar mas bloques y asi poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel Z. H. is 24 years old and works manufacturing and selling concrete blocks for the construction of houses and commercial buildings. There is great demand for this product in the area; most local constructions use this type of material because it is resistant and economical. Mr. Z. tells us that this business has been a great blessing for him, since it has generated income to cover his personal expenses and the financial obligations he has contracted. His wife has been a great support in helping him develop his small enterprise. His goal is to be able to produce more blocks and thus provide a better quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cement and sand

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Laura Tomasa

texts.en:
Laura Tomasa S. P. is 42 years old and lives in the Isla Trinitaria area of Guayaquil. Ms. S. owns a pharmacy, where she sells vitamins, medicine, aspirin, and school supplies. Business has been tough recently due to the recession and an increase in local competitors.  As a result, Ms. S. would like to diversify her inventory. 

Ms. S. is requesting a loan to purchase pre-paid phone cards, holiday decorations, Christmas gifts, a compressor, and beauty supplies. In the future, the Sorianos would like to secure the cane portions of their home with cement.  Ms. S. and her husband dedicate a portion of their incomes to support their only son who is finishing college.  She is grateful for any assistance we can provide for her business so that her family may prosper!

loans.use: to expand her inventory

loans.name: Ninfa Roselia

texts.es: la sra. NINFA ROSELIA M. P. tiene una pequeña pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "PATRICIA" , hace poco establecio su negocio, Ninfa es viuda desde hace varios años, con los pocos ingresos que le generado su negocio ha podido sacar adelante su hogar, sus hijos ya estan todos adultos y este negocio la entretiene y le genera ganancias ya que es su unica fuente para ganarse la vida, ahorita ella esta pasando por una situacion dificil y necesita capital para poder comprar mercaderia al por mayor y asi surtir mas su negocio,  el cual le generara mayores ventas e igual mejorara sus utlidades las cuales le ayudaran para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Señora NINFA ROSELIA M. P. has a small grocery store (pulpería) that she operates under the name Pulpería Patricia. She established her business a little while ago. Ninfa has been a widow for several years. With the small amount of income that her business has generated, she has been able to take good care of her home. Her children are already adults and this business keeps her busy and generates profits for her since it is her only source of earning a living. Currently, she is going through a difficult situation and needs capital to be able to buy merchandise wholesale so she can supply her business more. This will generate more sales for her and also will improve her usefulness, which will help her improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy churros, soft drinks, dairy products, juice in boxes and cans, candy, chocolate, dulce de leche, bread, and cookies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yamileth Argentina

texts.es:
YAMILETH ARGENTINA R. se dedica al comercio cuenta con una pequeña tienda de venta de juguetes y peluches denominada ALFA Y OMEGA actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace mas de 5 años, esta 
casada y es madre de familia, tiene un hijo,  con los ingresos que me genera este negocio le permiten suplir algunos gastos personales y estudios universitarios ya que es pasante de la carrera de microbiologia en la Universidad Regional. con este  credito que esta solicitando es para invertirlo en su negocio ya que se aproxima la temporada de mejor venta del año, la epoca es de la cosecha de maiz , frijoles y café que son el rubro de esta region Oriental de Honduras.
texts.en:
YAMILETH ARGENTINA R. is dedicated to commerce and has a small store where she sells toys and stuffed animals. It is called, "Alfa y Omega." She has been dedicated to this activity for more than 5 years. She is married and is the mother of one son. With the income that her business generates, she is able to pay for some personal expenses and some university studies since she is studying microbiology at the Universidad Regional. With the credit she is requesting, she will invest in her business since the best sales season of the year is approaching. This is the season to harvest corn, beans, and coffee since these are the trades of this eastern region of Honduras.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toys and stuffed animals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
El señor Wilmer P. de 39 años de edad se dedica a vender ropa usada, Administrando su negocio desde hace 9 años, vende todo tipo de ropa para adultos y niños. cuenta con la ayuda de una tia y 
una de sus sobrinas, ellas viajan a talanga a vender de casa en casa la ropa y de igual manera el lo hace en las colonias cercanas. Wilmer vive con su mama quien tiene una pequeña pulperia la cual don Wilmer quiere surtir con parte del credito que esta solicitando, al igual que comprar mas ropa para vender.
los clientes  son sus vecinos y personas que transitan el lugar, que lo conocen y lo admiran mucho ya que a pesar de tener una deficiencia fisica (Deformacion de Columna) no deja de trabajar y su sueño es crecer y aumentar sus ganancias el cliente invierte mensualmente $417.00 y vende $767.00
teniendo una ganancia de $350.00 mesuales. 
Wilmer se siente muy feliz y es muy amable, fue muy grato pasar la tarde con el.
texts.en:
Señor Wilmer P. is 39-years-old and sells used clothing. He has had this business for 9 years. He sells all types of clothing for adults and children. He has the help of his aunt and one of his nieces. They travel to Talanga to sell clothing from home to home and they also do this in nearby towns. Wilmer lives with his mom, who has a small grocery store that Wilmer wants to supply with part of the credit he is requesting. He will also buy more clothing to sell. His clients are his neighbors and people who travel in the area. They know him and admire him a lot since he has a physical shortcoming (a spinal deformation). He doesn't stop working, and his dream is to grow and increase his profits. He invests $417 and sells $767 every month, which means he has a monthly profit of $350. Wilmer is very happy and is very friendly. It was very pleasant to spend the afternoon with him.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
Filomena V., es integrante del grupo Esmeralda, trabaja con Pro Mujer hace 12 años aproximadamente,  recuerda que después de tres meses de capacitación logró sacar el préstamo para invertir en su negocio, aspecto que en la actualidad ha cambiado mucho. Filomena con el  pasar del tiempo emprendió  diferentes negocios como la  costura de ropa, tejido de prendas de vestir y venta de calzados, en los cuales tuvo éxito, actualmente se dedica al tejido de ropa y necesita el préstamo para comprar lana.
Sus demás compañeras también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de plásticos, venta de alimento seco, venta de ropa,  y tejido de alfombras.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
Filomena V. is a member of the Esmeralda Group, which has been working with Pro Mujer for approximately 12 years. She recalls that after three months of training she was able to acquire a loan to invest in her business. This has brought about many changes for her. Filomena now spends her time pursuing different business activities such as sewing clothes, weaving, and selling shoes. She currently produces fabric used for making clothing and needs a loan to buy wool.

The other members also have their own retail businesses selling plastics, dried foods, clothing, and woven rugs. They all need a loan to buy merchandise and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & raw materials

loans.name: Mi Progreso Group

texts.es:
ANTONIA T. V., tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad. Ella integra el grupo “Mi Progreso”, y al igual que los otros 9 integrantes residen en la zona de Carabayllo.
La Sra. Antonia,  hace 8 meses, se dedica a prestar servicio de mototaxi. Todo empezó cuando adquirió el vehículo que sería para que lo trabaje su hijo menor, pero se le presentó la oportunidad de hacer taxi en auto, por lo que ella al ver la moto guardada y que no generaba ingresos, se propuso aprender a manejarla, inició los trámites para sacar su brevete y es así que empezó a trabajar, y también hace servicio escolar al medio día.
Con sus ingresos, cubre parte del pago de un auto que sacó a crédito junto con su esposo para que hiciera servicio de taxi.
El préstamo solicitado lo destinará a la compra de repuestos para el carro y llantas para la mototaxi.
texts.en:
ANTONIA T. V. is 46, married, and has 5 adult children. She is a member of the "Mi Progreso" group. She and the other 9 members live in the area of Carabayllo. Señora Antonia has had a motorcycle rickshaw service for 8 months. Everything started when she acquired her vehicle so her youngest son could use it to work. When he had the opportunity to drive a taxi, she knew that keeping the motorcycle put away wouldn't generate any income. She decided to learn how to drive it. She started the process to earn her license, and this is how she started to work. She also offers school service at noon. With her income, she covers part of a car payment that she obtained on credit along with her husband to have the taxi service. The loan she is requesting will go towards the purchase of parts for her car and tires for the motorcycle rickshaw.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of car and motorcycle rickshaw parkts

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda B. is from the village of Bolisong, Kinoguitan Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Imelda is married and has six school-age children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Imelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita B. is from the village of Linabu, Balingasag Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Carmelita is married and has 6 school-aged children. Carmelita owns and operates a variety store selling food and other daily-use items to the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Carmelita is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional inventory. This will be the first loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
